Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Stephi D
Reviews.Content: This is nicest boutique hotel I have stayed at in a long time. Friendly, funky, well-designed home from home, great food and incredibly nice staff (Suzie, Craig, Pam etc). It has a club and a bar but my room was not at all noisy and I wanted to stay a lot longer than my four days. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect”
Reviews.Author: perosquared
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Toronto for work, scheduled to stay at a large downtown hotel when I came across the reviews for the Drake on Tripadvisor. We decided this place sounded a lot more interesting, so we switched our reservations over, and I'm very happy we did. Location is incredibly convenient - West Queen West is a straight shot by streetcar to anywhere you'd need to be, and there are so many great restaurants and shops nearby, we found ourselves enjoying a 3-4 km walk between conference and hotel just because we wanted to stop in at so many places. The hotel is right across from a public parking lot, where we easily prepaid for the whole stay's worth of parking, no worries at all. The hotel itself is easy to find and just lovely - modern design, a great gift shop of quirky presents, fantastic bath products, and an all-around friendly and cool atmosphere that never crossed into hipper-than-thou territory. I had been a little worried about noise since it was St Patricks Day weekend and I had to be up early every day, but the sounds of the restaurant faded as soon as we walked into the room hall, and only one or two short instances of chatter were all we ever heard or saw of other guests or pedestrians, even though we were just on the 2nd floor. (Room 205 was perfect.) One aside: I saw several reviews here mentioned the manager by name, and how fantastic he was. I found this a little surprising, since how many places that aren't b&b do you even meet the manager? However, we had a minor issue with our room (pipe leaking), and not only did Jonathan find us for a personal chat about it with options, he was so incredibly nice and helpful about it that I could immediately see why people remember his name and rave about him. I would absolutely stay here again. I would not recommend the place to older guests uncomfortable with a semi-club atmosphere in the evenings, or those with kids who need space or amenities of chain hotels, but thumbs up to couples, close friends (the glass showers are awesome but there is no mystery to be had), and those passing through wanting something beyond a cookie cutter room!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful, fun and friendly - can't imagine better!”
Reviews.Author: Annie O
Reviews.Content: My partner and I just spent our anniversary at The Drake and swore we will regularly find reasons to return. Jonathon and all of the staff give the place its 'heart' and add to the pampering that the funky rooms( including 'steps from the bed' shower and amenities plus uber-comfy mattress and comforter), great artwork and fabulous food provide. Despite their being a live band downstairs, our room was peacefully quiet. Grabbing coffee and fresh baked goodies from the diner downstairs made checking out a delight. Thank-you, thank-you, thank-you to Jonathon et al for making our stay so incredible. Can't wait to come back! Annie & Jeff

Reviews.Title: “Funky rooms, cool bar, interesting burning smell”
Reviews.Author: OakvilleChipmunk
Reviews.Content: I booked the Drake for an anniversary surprise for my wife, with dinner at Scaramouche thrown in. The hotel room was good, although a little expensive at $279 plus tax. In our room was a noisy fan heater, which I managed to switch off after fiddling with the wall thermostat for five minutes. On returning from dinner we discovered that someone had been in the room, plumped the pillows and turned the heater on. There was a bad smell of burning, the kind you get when you switch on a dusty heater for the first time in months. That pretty much ended the special date night, as I spent 20 minutes trying to ventilate the room and make the air breathable. On check out I mentioned this disappointment, but the front desk lady just shrugged and said "I'm sure it's fine". I don't know whether she meant that the heater was fine, or the burning smell ruining my stay was fine. I won't be visiting the Drake again.

Reviews.Title: “another perfect trip.. like coming home.”
Reviews.Author: kklowrider
Reviews.Content: Just left my third stay at The Drake and this time for a birthday celebration. Jonathan Leclaire and the front desk team (Craig, Pam, Zoey) made me feel like I was coming home. The Drake is a fun hotel, gitchy rooms, well appointed, and plenty-o-fun with mutiple packed bar/ restaurants even in the dead of winter. It is the staff, however, that sets this place apart from any other boutique hotel. Jonathan and his crew made every meal and activity happen that we asked for help with. Far beyond that, they personalized the stay in such a way that they did things to make my days better that I would not even have thought of myself. If you stay, do not hesitate to ask for suggestions and assistance, you will not be disappointed. Important tidbits I learned on the third round: the burger should not be missed, and the sushi is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “The best Nachos ive ever had!”
Reviews.Author: Anastasia Y
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a relaxing atmosphere, somewhere where you can just relax and catch up with your friends after work or class the drake hotel is the place you're looking for! I went there with my co-workers recently and we sat on the patio with heaters by their gas fire and enjoyed some nice drinks and their AMAZING food. I personally ordered the Nachos with the lobster! They were a little on the expensive side, $25.00 with tax but SO worth it :) I highly recommend the drake hotel and their yummy nachos!

Reviews.Title: “Fun and cosy”
Reviews.Author: SusanTO7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for anniversary weekend away. Loved the Crash Pad (small room). Bed was springy and soft, everything was super clean. Room had lots of little treats but they cost extra. The little card will tell you the prices of trinkets and snacks that you'll find in your room, if you choose to eat them. Public use PC at the top of the stairs was great to look up some info quickly. Note that if you book one of the smaller rooms, the (very nice and clean) bathroom is right at the foot of you bed. If you're sharing the room with someone, best to make sure you're very comfortable with each other bathing and using the washroom so close to you. Loads of great restaurants and bars in the area, and right in the hotel itself. Staff were great and really helpful. Would stay here again for a weekend away. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown Toronto boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Justin P
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent a night at the Drake Hotel. We had high expectations, and they were more than met. Rooms are really cool, interesting layout and good use of space. Lots of neat little additions - major attention to detail. We had drinks in the lounge, which was cozy and relaxed. The Hedgehog was a unique cocktail - my wife wrote down the recipe to recreate at home. We had dinner in the dining room, good atmosphere and generally a good place to hang out. Reasonably priced - scallop dish was great. Steak frites also great, and both were healthy portions. We ended up heading to bed early and not visiting the music venue downstairs, but couldn't hear a thing in our room, even though we were on the second floor. Bed was very comfortable. Breakfast the next morning in the cafe was awesome. You don't even need to leave the hotel to be entertained and to dine properly. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “The Coolest Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TBS-Funtimes
Reviews.Content: You stay at some places and you can feel the history. You stay at the Drake and you can feel the vibe. This place is the coolest hotel I have ever stayed in. The rooms are ultra-funky, the restraunt is top notch and the bar (balcony and main floor) is the place to be. The location is a little distance from the center of Toronto, but well worth it. The staff are as hip as the place it self. Definately worth the splurge. Definately.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Birthday Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Carlene M
Reviews.Content: I took my husband to the drake for a romantic birthday weekend in November. We stayed in a den on a Saturday night, and had breakfast at the cafe on the Sunday morning. Our room was gorgeous. My husband was blown away by the sexy ensuite bathroom with frosted glass sliding doors. I loved the rockin' MCM furniture pieces and fresh art throughout the room - especially the friendly stuffed figure propped up on our bed! The staff was friendly and helpful. Not only did they remember to wish my husband a happy birthday as we checked in, but they also took the time to write a Happy Birthday postcard to my husband, which was waiting for us in our room. They really helped to make my husband's birthday special. When we were heading out to another venue, the staff took the time to ensure we had proper directions and knew the best route to take to our destination. We slept soundly, with no issues at all. The next morning, we had a lovely breakfast in the Drake cafe. My husband was very pleased with his lumberjack breakfast (I especially loved the hashbrowns!) and I had the eggs benedict - amazing. My favorite part of the breakfast was my latte. Amazing. All in all, the Drake hotel has surpassed all our expectations, and we will be booking another trip soon! An absolutely outstanding hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy A
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights at the Drake recently. At every corner the staff went out of their way to make sure that we had everything we needed. Jonathan, the manager, grabbed our bags and carried them to our room, then refused a tip. He gave us wonderful dinner ideas and then made the reservations for us. JIll, at the front desk, was also a warm, welcoming and kind host. Upon every return, she would ask us where we had been and about the interesting things we had found in the neighborhood. We had drinks at thte hotel every night - who would have thunk that the hotel was the place we would want to be? We had great service first from Kim downstairs then later from Stuart upstairs. The food was pretty good too. Who could complain about pretzels and proscuitto? The rooms are clean, interesting and large - at least much larger than the dumpy hotel we stayed in after we got bumped from our flight home. I would certainly reserve a room at the Drake for my next trip to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool bar ,”
Reviews.Author: Clearo
Reviews.Content: Loved the music and artworks - great spot , highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Bubbly, fantastic and exceeds expectations”
Reviews.Author: creemoreman
Reviews.Content: Kayla: possibly the nicest human being I've ever encountered. Jonathan: if you need anything done, he can do it. The hotel front desk is nothing short of amazing. Rooms are funky, cool and a lot of fun. Great use of space; glass shower walls are a blast. Sushi bar in the lounge is the real deal; sit at the bar and soak up the atmosphere--incredibly friendly staff. Hotel is about 10 minutes from the 'core' of the City--but, you don't need to leave this area, it's awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing short of perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Gage L
Reviews.Content: The Drake offers some of the best service I've ever received from a hotel. The rooms are well designed, clean and honestly, sometimes I liked to pretend I was rich and the room was my apartment. :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: AlanStuartM
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Drake at the start of July 2010 - Unfortunately not previously had the opportunity to write a review. It was our first stay, and our honeymoon - Not the normal type of destination, but for me the Drake is perfection! Without doubt I will choose the Drake above any other hotel downtown from now on. To break it down for you: Location - Excellent central location just a street car ride into downtown toronto - The street care really does stop outside the hotel so never fear getting lost. Room Facilities: We were accommodated in one of the Crash Pad rooms, overall quality of the room is what we expected. LCD television; free internet access and safety deposit box; Malin and Goetz products always a plus - Keep your eye out for the quirky bits and bobs... Hotel Facilities: These range from excellent to even more excellent - The full range of facilities available to guests from the Sky Yard bar, downstairs cafe to full on club night and venue at night. The â€œBagel + Loxâ€� breakfast served downstairs is stunning!! The Drake, for sure, is THE hottest place in town! The culture; the attitude and the environment is unbeatable - 5 Stars!

Reviews.Title: “Just back from The Drake....”
Reviews.Author: ckla2011
Reviews.Content: I've stayed there many times, and last week's was true to form: epic! The Drake has the best service of any hotel (big or small) that I've experienced - and I travel a lot! Where else can you walk in and be greeted by name, have each and every request immediately met, in a cool, seamless fashion. Jonathan LeClaire, Zoe, cafe staff.....all wickedly good at what they do. Can't wait to hang with them next month.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: NorthLeeds
Reviews.Content: The reception staff at the Drake were amazing on our recent visit. We arrived late and very tired at midnight on a very busy Friday night ~ a queue of people outside and a loud and busy reception area. I must say a massive thank you to alan who was perfect.... Got us to our room, arranged food to be brought to our room, he relaxed us and provided exactly what we needed. Don't worry about noise from the club and bar, the sound proofing really works. The next morning the staff were equally as good and really put us at ease. The Drake is the centre of West Queen St cool, the room was beautifully designed, the bar and restaurant are great. A definite recommend and a definite return visit from ourselves the next time we're in Toronto. This is one hotel which lives up to it's website and reputation.

Reviews.Title: “You're family at the Drake!”
Reviews.Author: Loredana L
Reviews.Content: I could not have survived TIFF this past September if it wasn't for the Outstanding Staff! I mean that with all my heart. From Zoe's warm and inviting smile, to wonderful Jerry and what to Say about Jonathan LeClaire...not sure I have enough space to write all I want to say. He went above and beyond the call of duty. This is an all inclusive Hotel...food, drink, music and friends.. It is more than a hotel stay...it's an experience! .oh yeah and the sexy energy the place gives off..You feel it as soon as you walk in. Best beds and pillows EVER!!!!! Loredana

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best hotel in the world; my favourite anyway”
Reviews.Author: theDiesta
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at The Drake a dozen times or so...there just is no comparison for a great spot to be in when in Toronto; no, you are not downtown (at least the centre part of it), and yes you are in a bit of an 'edgier' area, but that's the best part: you are in a real neighbourhood. The staff could not be any cooler and friendlier--not usually the combination one assumes when thinking 'cool staff in a cool hotel'. The secret however is that these are real people, who are really cool (many of them artists) and not people who put on an act to try and score tips by pretending to be what you think you want them to be. The rooms (I've stayed in a crashpad and a Studio, are the height of functional design; smaller probably than other rooms in the city, the crashpads are literally just that. Enough space to sleep, refresh and store your stuff for a night or three. The studio and larger rooms have great little seating areas and a bit more space to throw your stuff around. All rooms have great use of space and great touches such as vintage hospital-type furniture (the chair in my room on my last visit). Bathroom products are good. Overall the Drake is more than a place to sleep--you're not going to be amazed by large rooms, amazing views or butler service--but you are going to get more-than-eager staff, incredible patios to relax on, a great sushi-bar, the best sound system in the city in the basement club and a great vibe. Enjoy the neighbourhood and let the Drake be your start/stop and rehydration point when doing so.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Honkycat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights at the start of September. Firstly, we had a very warm welcome to the hotel by Zoe which was great. After struggling up stairs with our bags and down a dimmly lit corridor we found our room. It was a "crash pad". The thing that just didn't appeal to me at all was that the bathroom is IN the room. A sliding door with light frosting for the toilet and clear glass for the shower. Personally, I like a degree of privacy in the bathroom so this was not for me. I know other more expensive rooms with different configurations are available, but the "crash pad" was expensive enough for me thanks. The toilet cystern dripped all night which disturbed my sleep too... I asked for it to be fixed but it never was (successfully at any rate). There were lots of trays of goodies in the room which is exciting at first.. until you realize there is absolutely nothing complimentary... not even mineral water... everything must be purchased. Another slightly wierd thing is that there are no plugs for the sinks. We asked at reception for one but there aren't any (they suggested we stuff a facecloth in the plug hole).... difficult for wet shavers. We tried the restaurant, but I'm a vegetarian and there was nothing I saw on the menu for me (I know the management has addressed this in other reviews saying there are some things and something could be made specially, but I think this should be made more apparent). My wife is not veggie, but there was nothing she fancied either. We actually went up the street to The Gladstone each night to eat (which was excellent by the way). We went into the breakfast bar the next morning. The girl behind the counter wasn't sure which parts of the menu we were allowed to order from at that time (10:30ish?) but then a waiter helped her out. The food was ok, but quite expensive for what it was (we went to the Starbucks down the street each morning from then on). The staff in the breakfast cafe also had a wierd attitude... more into their own little world and conversations that the customers. We felt a bit uncomfortable.. (except for Chels?.. she was really nice). We tried the rooftop bar one night and ordered a pitcher of sangria... oh dear.. it tasted like grapefruit juice and we had to leave most of it. It cost $30 odd too so we didn't go back there either. The hotel is a good 25 min walk from the centre which is a bit of a pain too.. I'd pick somewhere closer if I went again. So, anyway, an interesting experience. Would I go again? No thanks.

Reviews.Title: “I'm sitting in the airport and do not want to go home”
Reviews.Author: redskier
Reviews.Content: Thank you All at the Drake. From Zowie and Criag at the start that checked us in to the Drake and sent our luggage up to the suite, we felt at home. Soon the phone rang in our suite and Johnathan call up to make sure we were ok. I tried to get him to come with us last night, but duty calls and he has decided to stay...lucky Drake! By the next day we had been nicknamed "the girls" and our 10 day vacation was off. Pam what would we have done without all the food advice during the stay, and all the laughs that we had at our antics. Thanks for kissing the squirrel for me.We love you Craig for letting us call you Alan for most of our stay without telling us otherwise. You are the best!Kayla and KiKi the Orbit Room and the Dakota were a balst and after one long night there we had to return to the Drake for a wardrobe change before continuing our dance party. Gordon, Sara, Jeff in the bar...made our time,albit a bit fuzzy, so wonderful and Im not sure going home to reality and not having you take care if us is going to work for me anymore. Arron...my love! I will be back and then we can marry and I will stay at the Drake forever :) Last, but never least...Matthew, the Godfather, Brooks. THANK YOU! You made a very big birthday even bigger, and made me feel like the special princess that I now know I am. To all of you, I am crying while I write this and want to stay with you forever...you will be missed! The best vacation EVER Love Rebecca

Reviews.Title: “Number one stay in TO!”
Reviews.Author: tanda89
Reviews.Content: We spent a few nights at the Drake at the end of July this summer.It was our second stay there and from now on we know this is it! We are returning visitors to Toronto and will choose the Drake above any other hotel downtown from now on. We can't commend this hotel's manager enough: Jonathan, you are the greatest! And yes, next time we will sit down and have that drink together! [;D] Also we were very impressed with other members of the crew: Terence, for one, who performed as a formidable host at Wednesday's Trivia in the lounge! What a nice way to come home, to have a few drinks and a couple of laughs. (I think we finished last in the pop quiz, but hey, who's counting?) We also really liked Dusan, the bartender, who chatted us up while we were waiting for a table..... Did I mention we're in our late forties going on fifty? The Drake, for sure, is THE hottest place in town! Can't wait to come back and do it all again, breakfast on the patio (excellent!) drinks at the Sky yard ( lovely sangria) and that super Raw bar!

Reviews.Title: “The Drake: Five Star Service and More”
Reviews.Author: vsirin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nicely renovated. Many old details remain (the terrazzo, in particular) and many new additions (the art, for instance) give the Drake a great look. It's not over-designed, by any means, and it comes off as interesting and real rather than mindlessly sleek. But it's the service that makes the Drake worth the stay. I arrived days before the film festival and the hotel was already packed. The sight of stacks of luggage behind the front desk was enough to tell me my room wasn't ready, but I was a few hours early, anyway. That was all right, I wanted a drink, really, and I told the woman behind the desk, Kayla, exactly that. She stepped from behind the desk and took me to the bar, introduced me to the bartender, Stephen, and asked me what I needed (a drink, a room), what I wanted to do during my four-day stay (bike, eat, art, drink), and moments later I was drinking a Creemore (a Canadian amber lager) Stephen recommended, and talking to Kiki, a Drake manager, about bike, eat, art, drink in Toronto . . . Within five minutes of my arrival, I had three positive contacts with the hotelâ€™s staff. And it was busy. Very busy. I was impressed. And I had three days, twenty-three hours and fifty-five more minutes of my stay remaining . . . My room was a â€œcrashpad,â€� Room 203, small, but smartly designed. Iâ€™ve stayed in larger rooms that felt smaller and were far less comfortable. The shower, sink and toilet were elevated from the rest of the room and each separated by a glass partition. The bathroom fixtures were modern and the glass surprisingly spotless. The queen-sized bed had expensive linens and four big pillows. I had plenty of racks and hooks to stow my stuff and the Drake even provided a terrycloth robe. My favorite touch was the umbrella. Every hotel ought to provide its guests with an umbrella, I think . . . I loved Toronto. Always a glass of water with a glass of beer. Dogs allowed on the streetcars. Washroom sounds so much better that bathroom. Brunch 24/7. The quietest big city ever, seldom a siren or a raised voice. Best city to ride a bicycle in, by far, even though I saw a girl get doored on Ossington Avenue . . . And the Drake. I loved the Drake. Kayla got me a bike to ride and when I broke it Jonathan, the hotel manager, got me another. When I wanted gallery suggestions, no one was more helpful than Meghan in the cafÃ©. When I wanted to know who Jack wasâ€”the Jack mourned in chalk graffiti all over the walls surrounding city hallâ€”Charlie and Meghan told me about Jack Layton, and I glimpsed the collective grief of a nation without reading a newspaper . . . And then there was Tony. Every encounter with Tony was delightful. I always seemed to catch him as he was leaving, accounting textbook in hand, off to study, earnest and eager as he is, but equally as eager and earnest to take time out to get me a latte or a table for breakfast. Or just time to chat with me about my day, a solo traveler, 500 miles from home . . .

Reviews.Title: “I had not been back in a few years and it still impressed”
Reviews.Author: Gary B
Reviews.Content: I am an artist from LA with family and business in the Toronto area. I spent five nights at the Drake over a two week period and was just as impressed with the staff, service, room and food as I was when I last stayed there over five years ago. An urban hotel that you want to hang out at to conduct business, have fun and just relax. Not to mention the many food outlets are amazing. I canâ€™t wait to come back; it just hit it on the nail. More cities should try this :) Gary

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: El_Mudo_11
Reviews.Content: If you want to experience Toronto off the beaten path, make the Drake your home base. We loved the hotel itself (ok, yes: small rooms and breakfast was not to be repeated but), the staff, the boutique, using the Drake bikes to go down to the lake and its location for great boutiques, restos and cafes. Get a pass for the trams and use them to get into town if you're lazy.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, Great Room and a fantastic Bachelorette Party”
Reviews.Author: kristye28
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing night at the Drake. Staff were exceptional and met all of our requests. The ground level bar was fun and cutting in line with our room keys was awesome. In room bathing products were very nice and the room was suprisingly spacious, comfortable and very well designed. 6 of us very much enjoyed lounging in the room and couldn't hear any of the bars until we opened the door.

Reviews.Title: “Service and scones”
Reviews.Author: vansensei2001
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Drake for just over a week. I was very happy with the location, the neighbourhood, and the gym membership for guests. I was solo so the crashpad room was alright for me, and I knew what I was expecting by reading previous reviews about the size of the room. The look of the room, hallways, and the entire hotel had a lot of detail. A friend staying in another hotel visited and loved the 80s movie quotes strewn throughout the place. Given its vibrant nightlife (which is eclectic and fun), I asked for and got one of the quieter rooms on the top floor and never heard a peep from the many bars. The only time noise was an issue was my last night from the neighbouring room; perhaps the couple had ordered something from the Pleasure Menu, which apparently and audibly did its job over and over again in the night and early morning. My other issue was the wi-fi signal that frustratingly got weak the further you went into the top floor hallway and became nearly zero upon entering the room. Glad they had the computer and printer for guests to use. But the thing Iâ€™ll remember about the place was the genuine and superlative service from the front desk, the cafe, the bars, and the security guards on the busy nights. (You really do feel like a rock star bypassing the queues since youâ€™re a guest). You get the sense that the front desk staff will go an extra mile to provide good, personable service. Kayla of the front desk got me hooked on the cafeâ€™s scones near the end of my stay, and I have to come back to try the donuts. I would easily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Drake made our wedding perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Laurie T
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married in May 2011 at the Drake hotel - the staff, service, venue, food and room surpassed all our expectations. From the earliest stages of the planning process, Ashley, the Drake's wonderful event coordinator, made planning our wedding easy and fun. She helped us create the vision we wanted for our special day, and did all the work, so we could just do the fun stuff. The wedding night itself was perfect. The food was absolutely incredible and we received so many compliments from our guests. The music by DJ Dougie Boom kept the dance floor packed all night. We received so many comments from our guests about the amazing service at the wedding- from the wait staff, to the bar staff, to the hotel staff. Jerry was great at welcoming everyone at the door (he kept our party goers happy and kept crashers out!). Many of our guests were so impressed that they emailed either us or the Drake staff the next day. It was great to hear that the staff weren't just helpful to us, (as the ones footing the bill!) but they were equally as dedicated to making sure everyone there enjoyed themselves. Jonathan, the hotel manager, was helpful both during the weeks leading up to the wedding and on the night itself. Our room was great! Since it was our wedding night, we treated ourselves to the suite. It was quite large and I love the design of everything - the room itself is like a work of art - but there is also plenty of cool looking art on the walls - two TV's too. I felt like I could just hang out in the room for days! There are lots of neat little touches too - design books and magazines, gourmet snacks and drinks in the mini-bar, luxury soap and shampoo in the bathroom, etc. My parents also had a room, the salon room, smaller than the suite, but it was still spacious enough for a bride, a niece, and three ladies to get ready for a wedding in, two photographers taking pictures, a mom standing by with moral support and a brother-of-honour...basically standing around I guess. My parents commented that when they went to the cafe for breakfast, the staff knew who they were right away and asked about the wedding - my parents loved that! The Drake is a great place to have dinner, to have drinks, to stay overnight, or to have an event. The atmosphere, the design and the food are all top notch, but I would say that the service and the staff are what sets the Drake apart.

Reviews.Title: “It's the only place we stay in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: plmcampbell
Reviews.Content: Quaint, hotel with excellent service. The staff are attentive without being overbearing. By the end of your stay they know your name and make sure to accommodate all of your wishes. Very personalized care! Luxury bath products in the rooms, delightful decorations. Its a must visit kind of place, not to mention VIP treatment in all three of the bars and restaurants on the premises which are always lined up. Bypassing these lineups are reason enough to stay

Reviews.Title: “Classy”
Reviews.Author: Farrah T
Reviews.Content: I had to stay two night for work...the night life was unreal in that place...it was a cool hot spot.

Reviews.Title: “I thought you'd never ask...”
Reviews.Author: kbird_1980
Reviews.Content: As a much belated Mother's Day night away, my mum and I took the train to Toronto to spend the the night together prior to me flying off to British Columbia. As her loving and devoted daughter, it was my job to select the accommodations. I had spent some summer mornings having brunch at the streetside cafe, seen a live show in the Underground and spent a memorable evening in the Sky Yard and thought it was time that I rounded out my experience at the Drake with an overnight visit. No one does customer service like the Drake and here's a little story to illustrate... Not only did I call and get a person on the phone after just a couple of rings, the person I got turned out to be Jonathon, the manager. Jonathon helped me choose his favourite room and gave me a rate that I couldn't say no to. He promised to arrange a car service to the airport for me and to make everything perfect in every way. When we arrived on a very, very hot May day, we were greeted with, 'you must be Kate and her Mum. We've been expecting you.' Indeed, we were. They carried our bags, left us a love note in the room and pointed us toward the places we needed to go. Although we didn't need a thing, we had our pick of great wine, delicious treats and interesting treasures for purchase in the room. As a person who loves Mother Nature, I was most pleased to see the efforts that the nice people at the Drake go to to ensure that she doesn't weep every time a guest checks out. There was a notable absence of waste - stupid little bottles of terrible shampoo were replaced with lovely regular sized bottles of everything a girl could need to clean herself up and instructions on how to purchase the entire bottle if desired. What an ingenious way to make sure that a half bottle of shower gel and the plastic it came in aren't winding up in the landfill. Also, the towels were the right size for a human body...not that I don't love drying off with the face cloths most hotels try to pass off as a bath towel...but they really had nice towels, too. We slept well in the cool, dark and peaceful room. The bed was excellent, the bedding was divine and we could hear the sound of laughter and happiness coming from outside. The sound was faint and charming and it sure beats the sound of the 401 rushing past or elevator doors opening. Early in the morning, we came out onto the landing and were greeted by Alan from the front desk who so kindly carried my enormous bag for me and said, 'Good morning Kate. We have coffee and cake ready for you to enjoy while you wait for your limo.' When we asked if he would like a piece, like a gracious host he said, 'I thought you'd never ask'. Good old Alan. Not only did he carry my things, join us for an early morning snack but he even crammed into the functioning photo booth with us so he could be documented as part of our memory for life. The car service they arranged for me was...well, there are really no words for how perfect it was. The driver was efficient and made the right kind of 6:00 a.m. ride to the airport conversation. Once he and Alan had loaded my things into the trunk and I came outside, he opened it to show me that all of my bags were safely inside, which goes a long way in reassuring a traveler that she'll get to BC with her underpants in order. As I sat in the airport awaiting my flight, I received an email from dear, sweet Jonathon. Remember him from the beginning? He rushed in in the morning to try to catch me and say goodbye but unfortunately I was just too stealthy for him, so he had to wish me a great trip by email. A great beginning to a great trip. I am pretty sure that the manager at the Comfort Inn doesn't do that. The customer service at the Drake lacks nothing. They do it just right.

Reviews.Title: “Plastic and Twee!”
Reviews.Author: Weeebay
Reviews.Content: If you're a Torontonian who not-so-secretly wishes you were a New Yorker, this is the hotel for you. Not cool like New York, the Drake makes up for it by trying way too hard. Service was of the brittle-smile variety. The room we stayed in was quite nice, if a bit noisy (we were on the Queen West side). We'd eaten on the side-patio before- it's a lovely spot beneath the trees. Looking around I spotted several Toronto-style hipsters who I'd previously seen playing tennis at Trinity-Bellwoods Park... they'd been playing at dusk, wearing headbands, short-shorts, aviator shades and Bjorn Borg beards... they couldn't see the ball with the sunglasses and kept swinging and missing, but seemed delighted with themselves nonetheless. At the Drake, they fit right in.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but funky. Great area.”
Reviews.Author: diamondsnowball
Reviews.Content: The rooms look like dorm rooms...funky, but tiny. I loved the area, but I'm not sure I would stay here again. The service is extraordinary, but the hotel is very small...I like a bigger, modern place with more activity.

Reviews.Title: “Very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: AD72
Reviews.Content: Please be aware that the rooms at this hotel are very small indeed. I know the website mentions the size but it still came as a shock. Also the toilet and shower and part of the bedroom. No privacy when using the toilet, just a glass door. If the rooms were cheaper this would not be an issue but you are paying top rates and not getting top facilities. The staff were fantastic both on reception and serving food. Wifi is provided throughout and is free. The bars and nightclub on the roof do get very noisy on Fridays and Saturdays. If you want to sleep before 2.30am book somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: MissMoreau
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent 2 nights at the Drake and it was very nice. The rooms are clean, the staff was nice and the hotel restaurent and bar was amazing. The only problem is the size of the bedroom. Tiny tiny tiny. And, it's true, there is no privacy when you want to go to the bathroom or take a shower. As a girl who need a lot of privacy, it was a problem but we managed to deal with it. It's also true that the hotel is located in a very hipster district, which was fine with me but can not please to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff - fun in an up and coming neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Veggiemel
Reviews.Content: This is absolutely more than a place to stay; it offers a lot more than a hotel experience, and the staff are a significant factor in this. From the front desk to the bars, they couldn't make you feel more welcome and at home. They let us dump our bags with them as we were too early to book in, and when we returned they'd taken them up for us! And then they let us leave them in the lobby until we were ready to get on the tram (a trip we took on their recommendation). Whenever you encountered the staff around the hotel, they always treated you as a long lost friend. The rooms remind me of a university halls of residence - there are so many personal touches (such as the hand made doll), and although our room ( a den) wasn't huge, a wooden ladder gave access to extra storage space. It felt a bit like staying with a friend: a friend who lives a little too close to a busy and noisy bar (don't come here for a good night's sleep - the windows need another layer of glazing.) The cosy glass sided shower and toilet cubicles are fine if you are not staying here for a luxurious break - but the addition of good quality bath products, towels and a robe are a nice touch. The air conditioning is efficient. The TV is fine and the ipod dock good. There was some interesting menus in the room - but I don't think you'd stay here, or come to this neighbourhood, if you were prudish anyway. There were some good recommendations for nearby restaurants if you don't fancy their own (not a good vegetarian selection). And the roof top bar was a very comfortable place to while away an afternoon and enjoy a late brunch. In the evening it had a real party vibe and the bar staff were great, which ever shift you encountered.

Reviews.Title: “We stay here often and always have a great time!”
Reviews.Author: lemurbd
Reviews.Content: I just had to post after reading some of the other reviews here. Sometimes I really wonder- do people pay any attention to what a hotel is all about, and more importantly do they take into account their own needs, when they book a room? The Drake is not about huge rooms, low prices, or a quiet time.. and it isn't by a mall. If you need those things, then stay somewhere else! What the Drake IS about is really fantastic food (and room service, get the breakfast in bed, it's worth it), fun bars and lounges (including a roof top bar in the summer that is great), beautiful rooms with everything you need and incredibly comfy beds, interesting people, art, music, and fun! Queen st is a great neighborhood if you aren't afraid of, you know, cities. Lots of cool shops, restaurants, art galleries, parks, etc. If you're afraid of live music, assume that anyone who dresses better than you is automatically a conceited jerk, or if you visited new york city once and never left the area around times square without fearing for your life, then stay away from the Drake. Everyone else, enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Possibly our favourite hotel in the known universe”
Reviews.Author: BarryNeville
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have had nothing but great experiences at the Drake. Having stayed there twice now, thought I'd skip the accolades and address some of the issues other reviewers seem to have: we've always found the staff, particularly the front desk, to be cheerful and pretty funny. There's a fair amount of irony in the Drake's DNA, which might account for the "too cool for school" attitude cited by another reviewer. But apart from a somewhat terse waitress, we've really enjoyed all staff interactions. As for the rooms, yeah, they're small compared to the Holiday Inn, but I'm from New York City, so they felt just fine. However, it's a pretty popular place, so if you just want a good night's sleep as opposed to a memorable experience, this is probably not for you. With bands, events, and a hearty nightlife, it can be a little loud (but again, with windows closed and AC on, had no trouble sleeping).

Reviews.Title: “disappointing service!!”
Reviews.Author: danas85
Reviews.Content: Ive really been looking forward to staying at this hotel for our trip to Toronto. I was really let down by the service we got over the phone. I called in 2 weeks before the reservation so I could account for all costs involved ie: incidental deposit on room. When I first called the drake the receptionist that picked up was very friendly I asked him how much I should expect the hold to be on my cc he said 1 night room charge plus we put an incidental hold on your cc for about 40% of the room. Which we would release to you upon checkout. That sounded perfect. I didn't want to much of a hold on my cc as Toronto was just a stop on our trip to Montreal. I than followed up with the hotel yesterday to confirm everything. This time the answer was different from the response I had the first time. She had told me that the deposit was now $150 on the cc or if I decided to pay with cash it would be $250 down. I Had explained to her the Conversation I had with the first guy and how I would be traveling and wasn't expecting to pay that much for a deposit fee. She understood and said that she would need a manager approval to possibly make the deposit lower. The manager of the hotel "Anna" phoned me back. And once again. I Heard a completely different amount to my surprise she had told me that in fact the cost was 250 cc or the option of 250 cash deposit. And that's how it has been for 4 yrs. When I had told her what the other employees had told me all she said was well I'm going to have to coach them on our policy. I asked her if she would lower that for me and and she also seemed to have a bit of an attitude after exposing to me that it was a boutique hotel. I've stayed at several boutique and 5 star hotels and never had treatment like this. I cancelled that reservation the next day and booked the Thompson hotel Toronto which is similar to the drake but not outdated and much more classy. This hotel would have been nice I was excited to check out the drake restaurant. But the service wasn't that great. If your thinking of staying here just be cautious that they are going to charge you the room total plus an extra $250. (which by the way was double are stay price.)

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TorontoQwerty
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a birthday celebration for my partner and I. The hotel itself is very hip and trendy however, parking was a bit annoying as there are only 2 reserved spots that are across the street for another store property. The hotel also has several lounges/bars/club downstairs making it a bit noisy if you are looking for a quiet place to stay. Everything about the hotel was in one word "hipster". The hotel staff was very accommodating and even put in a nice birthday balloon for my partner. We were in the crashpad room, small but nicely laid out. The only caution I would provide is that the washroom and shower is literally right in front of your bed so if you are staying with friends/family it might not be the best idea as there is no door and the shower is just a glass wall that you can be seen at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Short but pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Mathieuuuuuuuuuuuuuu
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the drake hotel with my wife for only one night. We were sleeping in the crash pad. We were expecting a small room, thats what we got. It was small but ive had worst, and everything was designed in a way that it didnt really pose any problem. We liked the attention given to small details, the drake certainly isnt like other hotels. Some people complained that it was noisy, well there is a lounge, a cafe, a rooftop bar and a concert hall in the basement, all 4 of those were packed full on the night when we stayed, and still when we closed the door to our room, we didnt hear a thing. We noticed when people in the other rooms around would shut their doors but tat was about it. We loved to watch some of the interesting magazines that were in the room. We also loved the assortment on Malin + Goetz products that were available for us to use: hand soap, moisturizing cream, shower soap, shampoo and conditioner, each one a different aroma, very nice. It was our wedding anniversary, I didnt fail to mention this when I booked, so we had a nice little card by the hotel management and a few choco and fruits waiting for us in the room, nice. We chuckled when we got our hands on their sex toy menu, but it was so expensive that we didnt get to try it. They also had a selection of porn flicks, not for rent tho, only for sale, 60$ per, we passed. There was also a big basket full of goodies, foods and night mask and stuff like that, it all seemed yummy, but as in every hotel, was too expensive to buy without feeling guilty. Location isnt the best, but your a short tram ride away from anywhere you would want to go, so who cares. Overall Drake was good, I dont regret staying there. But it was for a special occasion and if it had been for more then one night, it would have been too expensive for us. Next time we are in Toronto we will stay somewhere else, but we're still glad we tried it, it was a good experience. Im sure some other people would enjoy it more then we did, especially those with bigger budgets.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting concept but disappointed us”
Reviews.Author: picklebunny1
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in the XL. The positive... There was some cool quirky artwork and photo books in the room... a menu for sex toys. Malin + Goetz shower products. The shower room was nice. Now on to the negative... I don't know if it was just the decorating, but our room (supposed to be the biggest in the place) seemed tiny. We appreciate art and culture, but are not hipsters by any stretch of the imagination so maybe it just wasn't for us. As someone stated previously, a lot the staff seemed "too cool for school"; they behaved as though we were troubling them whenever we asked for anything (advice on where to go, cabs etc.). Charged us a ridiculous price for a toothbrush/small toothpaste combo (NOT a fan of hotels who try to get away with things like this, and the hand cream example cited earlier... very unethical). Also, not conveniently located for sightseeing or shopping in the core (our fault for not doing enough research, not theirs, but just so you are aware). Overall, disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “tired of the chain hotels, decided to try a boutique instead!”
Reviews.Author: artifactory
Reviews.Content: I use TripAdvisor almost all the time before booking hotels. and I think every time I find the ratings giving to a hotel are pretty accurate. Although I have to wonder whether those who give poor or bad reviews are those who experienced it only once and those who actually don't bother to write a review are the ones who have to say all the good things about certain hotel, but never make it to the pool of reviews for whatever reason. Anyhow, the hotel at first when we called (we drove there) as we were approaching the hotel from the 401; seemed quite welcoming...the person who answered the phone at the front desk was respectful, she pointed that the hotel had only a few spots for parking and offered us one of them as it was available for the night we were staying. When we arrive to the hotel, there was no spots available in the parking lot (small lot across the street) my spouse waited outside while I went inside and find out if it there was an actual spot reserved for us. The person parked in our spot was a manager or perhaps a supervisor, not sure, but she was pregnant and she ran out to the street to move her car! I was so worry she was going to fall in the middle of the road or something..... anyways we checked-in and were treated with respect... The lobby is small and it shares the entrance with a funky bar/restaurant. There are all kinds of artifacts, that looked tasteful all around. As went up stairs we noticed some interesting photographs on the walls, and beautiful chandelier... very chic. The hotel was being a host for the CONTACT photography festival that was happening.. and the reason we visited TO. Before we entered the rooms area (there is a locked door where you need to use your room key to go through) we wondered through the hallway, a dark long hallway that it is illuminated by hanging mini-red-lampshades, with a chain with the room number. We were curious to see the interior. We didn't see any photos of the hotels before we booked it. so We were really curious to see what they look like, we entered the room and it was a surprise!! It was decorated very tasteful and colorful and modern and classy at the same time. we loved it!. It was a nice atmosphere to be in, we usually stay at the Sheraton downtown or at the Sheraton airport location and we were tired of all the 'fancy' drapery that these kind of hotels have. The rooms were awesome, the set up for the shower, toilet, sink, all were positioned in a very organized way. At the end, we ended up staying an extra night because we loved it so much. The people was great to deal with, love this place! I think if there was a negative thing, and isn't negative at all is just a small detail... was the restaurant service was a little bit slow..... but we didnâ€™t care. Love this place, and now we are looking forward to stay in another boutique hotel somewhere else!!

Reviews.Title: “Love it or hate it”
Reviews.Author: wilhornis
Reviews.Content: Small but stylish rooms. Noisy, both from inside and outside. Far from downtown, in an arty farty neighbourhood. Count all the pros and cons and you end up average, doubt if thats worth the 200 can dollars I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Looks good but pricey!!”
Reviews.Author: tricks23
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a funky boutique hotel and the Drake ticks all the boxes - however, crash pads really are tiny rooms with shower and toilet pretty much at the end of the bed. Low lighting doesn't help if you're trying to get ready for a night out and no natural light due to window being blocked by brick wall. Overpriced for the size of the room, not even a complimentary bottle of water! However, 90% of staff were great and if it's a funky/pretentious atmosphere you're looking for, this is it. Advice? Drink at the bar, stay elsewhere - your money can be better spent!!

Reviews.Title: “The Drake, part deux!”
Reviews.Author: apollo_e
Reviews.Content: The test of a good, if not great, hotel might be its ability to deliver time and again a memorable, fantastic experience...and here the Drake does not disappoint! We planned a trip in April to celebrate a birthday and secured the suite for the weekend. The largest guest room at the boutique hotel, it was more of the same quirky, charming, eclectic bent as the room we stayed in last time, albeit more spacious and with more nifty touches. Yes, the funny, funky doll with chest hair and bondage gear was there, but so was a big screen TV hooked up to DVD player; a very cool sitting area with daybed/sofa, and original art throughout. Despite being the largest room, it was still compact and made great use of space. Again, like last time, be warned that the Drake is a happenin' joint with music and people bouncing around until the wee hours of the morning...it was loud but it felt right and we had no problems sleeping through the bass thump and waking up in the morning to the smell of coffee and baking. Yum! Speaking of which, the brunch was fantastic and the weather was beautiful so the patio was open and we got to experience good food and people watch all in one sitting! As usual, the staff without exception, were phenomenal and are a huge reason why we came back and will keep going back...warning! pay attention to parking signs on the street...had the misfortune of mis-reading the sign on a friday afternoon and fell asleep/took a nap...woke up at 6pm and the car was gone! Sigh. Off to the impound lot to collect the vehicle and park in the right spot. My bad. The Drake staff heard about it and comiserated with me...even got a free drink at dinner which helped...and they also brought out cake...what a fantastic experience (car being towed aside) and we can't wait to get back there again!!! Highly recommend the Drake for a unique and amazing experience...

Reviews.Title: “The Drake has it all, but the real standout here is the service.”
Reviews.Author: bettyegan220
Reviews.Content: The Drake has it all -- a funky sense of style, chic and convivial spaces for dining and lounging, compact and expertly designed rooms, innovative and streamlined furnishings, comfy beds, sleek bathrooms â€“ but the real standout here is the service. The Drake's warm and welcoming vibe is genuine and you feel it the moment you step inside. Not so much as a hint of attitude, just classic hospitality at its best. Don't miss the Sky Deck, especially if you have little ones. You can sink back on the atrium's long banquette or gather round the fire pit and roast marshmallows -- quite a treat for our 10-year-old daughter!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service!”
Reviews.Author: julian_212
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel! Great rooms, and the most thoughtful, friendly service we've encountered in any hotel in the world.

Reviews.Title: “This place ROCKS-don't stay anywhere else if you really want to have a great time all around!”
Reviews.Author: kelamogold
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough great things about The Drake Hotel. The location is perfect if you are looking to enjoy the cutting edge side of Toronto. The staff is beyond awesome-talk about personable, professional and on-the-money with every single recommendation for restaurants and clubs, as well as shops. Major Kudos to Stephanie, Pam and Madison who consistenly pointed us in the right direction. Jonathan knows how to run a fabulous boutique hotel, and Matthew is beyond compare running the food and beverage side of things (and he knows EVERYONE in Queen's West-don't hesitate to ask him for suggestions if you want to experience the best of meals anywhere in the area). Don't miss "battle of the chefs" on Monday nights-we were there on Kimchi night and it was too much fun. Get there early for a table-you have never seen a restaurant or club get packed like this on a Monday night. Yes, I know the rooms are small-very Euro in their styling, but they are well appointed and very functional (and let's face it, the bathrooms are sexy and geared for the exhibitionist in all of us). Love the voodoo-style dolls (hairy man, I wanted to take you home with your leather thong). The beds are comfy, I appreciate the recycling bins, and the pleasure guide is like no other "room service menu" you've ever seen. How can you not love this place? Because we travel for business quite a bit, we were looking for something other than the typical chain hotel experience, and I found it at The Drake Hotel. I won't stay anywhere else when I'm back in Toronto, because the people who run this "home away from home" are the absolute best!

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: saltandbutters
Reviews.Content: From the phone call when we booked to our breakfast in the cafe the morning we left everything and everyone was great and more than we could have hoped for. The food is amazing, the staff is fantastic, the rooms are really neat and the pleasure menu is very fun and different

Reviews.Title: “Wow I cant wait to go back for TIFF”
Reviews.Author: redskier
Reviews.Content: This is the best of the boutique hotels that I have ever stayed in, and I have stayed in quite a few. The staff is so nice and made us feel so special. Thanks to Madison, Stephanie and Pam at the desk making sure to never steer us wrong. ,.dinner, lunch whatever we needed. Thanks to Johnathan and Matthew for making this place such a great experience. I felt like pat of the family there, and they keep the Drake at their best. I cannot wait to come back to visit them again. Thanks so much, Rebecca

Reviews.Title: “The Hippest Hotel in Toronto--even if you are not”
Reviews.Author: JB315
Reviews.Content: I stayed in CrashPad--small but very thoughtfully designed. Japanese esthetic as filtered through kitschy '50's vibe. Drake is located in Arts District of Queen St West--a bit sketchy but still fine for a single female after dark. Artsy, young and pretty clientele. Live music on the weekend, but my room at the back of the hotel was very quiet. Absolutely outstanding service from the charming and professional staff--notably Kayla at the Front Desk, Jonathan the manager, Tony and the other barristas. Public parking across the street--$12 for 24 hours. No elevator--but Jonathan carried my very heavy suitcase up 2 flights of stairs. Great espresso perfectly prepared (with astonishing spreed!) by Tony Didn't eat at the hotel, but Jonathan provided restaurant recommendations which were excellent.. I look forward to staying at the Drake again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Chic minimalism”
Reviews.Author: Christina_Marie_1900
Reviews.Content: Stayed and ate in The Drake, art district on the West-end. I cite this because now I know all of this! Loved it, very contemporary, and chic. The restaurant was fantastic and fun, the wine list was limited, we enjoyed our selection. Quaint guest room, and by quaint we mean very small, however, intelligently assembled and finished..absolutely refreshing. The servers were fantastic, from the bellhop, water attendants, wait staff, to The Drake Coffeehouse next door where I had breakfast and wonderful pastries. Make sure you try the PGB salsa with your eggs & home fried potatoes. Wonderful and fun experience. Bed was super comfortable, and the hotel was very quiet. Not for families with children, but nice for a couple.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, definitely try it :)”
Reviews.Author: dariabudgie
Reviews.Content: Landed in Toronto from England, stayed two nights at the Drake, great friendly and helpful staff, room yes a little small, we paid extra for a suite and found it spot on. Nice walk into the centre with many 'cool' little shops on the way. Great bedrooms, comfortable beds, lounge on a night was great, even the Sky bar was busy and it was December. If you want something a little different, try this place out, I'm sure you'll like it, we did :)

Reviews.Title: “Very cool Hotel on Queen Street West”
Reviews.Author: JamieD26
Reviews.Content: The Drake is a very cool hotel, cool rooms, bar, scene. The price is good for downtown Toronto and the food in the main lounge and dining room is very good. If you like to go out to be seen - you will love this place. Also right on the Queen streetcar - 10 minutes from downtown. Highly recommended as a Hotel and a destination all to it's own

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic and unique experience”
Reviews.Author: AdamDenning
Reviews.Content: We found the Drake online and had never been to Toronto. When we arrived, we were unsure if we should stay there because the wedding we attending seemed a bit far away. We me the manager Jonathan at the front desk and he convinced us to stay by telling us we had his favorite room. It might of been a bit of a fib, but it was pleasant and nice. We reconsidered and Jonathan also gave us one of his parking spots as an enticement. I am really glad he did, because we have never had as good a time as we did at the Drake. The service was excellent. The room was uniquely decorated. The food was fantastic. We had a couple of little problems (a clogged toilet and one other I can't remember) and they were handled immediately with no trouble. They best thing about the Drake, in my opinion, was the nightlife. We didn't have to leave the hotel to meet people and socialize. We met mostly locals who were surprised that we were staying there because it has been a renowned night spot in Toronto for years. They seemed envious. It must be well regarded by the locals. We stayed in 203. I have read complaints about noise here, but even though we retired long before the bars cleared out, we didn't hear any noise that would keep someone up. And we slept with the windows open. Breakfast was really good. The coffee was a little cold by the time it got to the room, but that was our only complaint. And given how great everything else was, it seemed like nothing. Jonathan and staff, you're doing a great job. Keep it up. We'll see you for the Molson Indy soon. Adam and Liz.

Reviews.Title: “Break outside the norm with the Drake!”
Reviews.Author: apollo_e
Reviews.Content: We had heard so much about the Drake that we just had to go. Having visited Toronto on many occasions, we have had the opportunity to stay at some of the swankier places the city has to offer: Soho Metropolitan (splurged for a junior suite & loved it! cool, chic aesthetic), Le Germain Toronto (another modern design hotel, the junior suite was excellent), Park Hyatt (spa is reason enough to go, room was okay), Intercontinental Yorkville (junior suite was very nice), the Metropolitan, the Cosmopolitan...all nice properties but the Drake more than distinguished itself from all others...quirky, eclectic, unique, cozy, charming are all adjectives that could be used to describe the Drake but what sealed the deal for us was the service. Jonathan greeted us on arrival and made sure our stay was as close to perfect as possible. He and the rest of the staff were fantastic, making sure all of our needs were met and were always courteous, polite and professional; some even downright friendly! And I don't mean, "We're paid to be friendly" type of friendly but genuinely nice...refreshing! Sure the rooms are small but use of space is inventive and the amenities are way too cool...love LOVE the "menu" of amenities...we can't wait to visit again to try out some of the other items on the list! :-) The restaurant, cafeteria, lounge/bar were all fantastic...the place was hopping Saturday night! Felt like a rock star pulling up to the front door in a cab, showing our room card and getting let in! LOL Livin' the dream! Stay at the Drake if you want an experience with soul; stay at the Drake if you want a place that is sexy and loud, retro, vibrant and a feast for the senses! Don't stay at the Drake if you want square footage, modern sleek decor or refined sensibilities. This place is all rock & roll!!! Vivre la difference!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Party-ing venue with rooms as a side venture”
Reviews.Author: WillnRoss
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated outside the centre of Toronto in an Arty but run down area. No parking, but there is a parking lot opposite which is inexpensive. Not what we expected. No elevator, rooms very small, but functional. Having the toilet and shower in the bedroom which is all one room was unusual but not bad. Air-con was noisy, Our main concern was not being able to get into the hotel some evenings as it was so busy as its a bit of a party venue. This I believe is what the Drake is about not hotels stays and looking after hotel guests, but actually looking after the local crowd. Noise on some evenings was way over the top! If you are a party animal and like a racket away from the centre and shopping of Toronto, pick this hotel, if not be sensible and choose another.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED the Drake, despite our initial first impression walking in the door.”
Reviews.Author: Molecularpenguin
Reviews.Content: The folks working at the Drake Hotel were fantastic. They really made our stay very convenient and easy. They provided tokens for the street car (added to tab) which we could jump on right across the street. We attended a musical downtown and they helped us plan our experience from what to eat and where, and how to get to the theatre, etc. There are a number of music venues tucked into the corners of the Drake. You can find entertainment right there! One night we wandered downstairs and caught a great singer songwriter act, without hearing a peep from the hip lounge scene above us. The hotel is so eclectic and we loved it. The rooms are small, and there is no privacy for the toilet (all glass walls around the loo). The bowel shy may find it a tad awkward. The restaurants on site and music venues on site, and the location of the hotel in the midst of the art district make this place really terrific. Although we seemed a little older than a lot of folks around us (we just turned 40), we had a great time. It was our anniversary and we got a great laugh out of reading the "pleasure menu" in the room. There were a lot of fun details that really made our stay fun. Thanks so much to all the gang at the Drake for making our anniversary in Canada terrific!

Reviews.Title: “A great way to wake up!”
Reviews.Author: EDP21
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at The Drake to celebrate my husband's 40th birthday. It was a great experience. Romy, the concierge who assisted me in my booking, was fabulous. She provided me with all the assistance I needed and was available to answer any questions I might have had. We had drinks on the SkyYard terrace, which was extremely busy, but fun. Sounded like the party continued well into the wee hours, but we were not too bothered by the noise when we headed to our room to turn in for the night. The beds and pillows were very comfortable. We enjoyed the Couples Spa Package the next morning with breakfast in bed and a couples massage, both being completely heavenly! The food was so delicious.. and plentiful.. not the little portions that you would find in many other high-class hotels. The massage was the perfect way to end our weekend in Toronto .. we never wanted it to end! Highly recommended!! If you're looking for something with high energy, alot of buzz and slightly off the beaten track, then The Drake is the place for you. This area around Queen St. West is going to blossom in the next 5-10 years, which is great for Toronto and The Drake.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: DCguy72
Reviews.Content: We spent one night in one of the "crash pad" rooms recently, and really loved it. The room was small, sure, but incredibly creatively decorated and with some nice amenities. The hotel itself is beautiful - in a great historic building - with several restaurants and bars. Best of all, the staff are incredibly friendly - something one doesn't often see in the hip/trendy places. It was slightly on the expensive side, but worth the price. My only complaint is that we weren't explicitly told we'd have to pay for parking - but we also didn't ask as we should have done. Overall, very much worth the price. Also loved the neighborhood - lots of cafes, galleries, restaurants, etc; also very close to Little Portugal, which was great.

Reviews.Title: “The Drake is the way to go in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Fridame
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel near the auto repair shop after our car experienced problems on the way out of Toronto. We were driving around lost in our wounded car when we came across the Drake At first we were not sure about the Drake Hotel. It is an older building in an older neighborhood. The night before we stayed downtown at the Metropolitan, a nice traditional safe hotel. We met Jonathan in the lobby and explained our situation. We were really stressed out, a car in need of repair, lost, no place to stay and getting late in the day. Jonathan was very reassuring. He made us feel welcome and put us at ease. He set us up with a room. Gave us directions to the repair shop and Jonathan and his staff even carried our bags up to the room. The room was interesting to say the least. Ultra modern Crash Pad. Lots of unique touches you won't find in a traditional hotel. Adult toys available, local art, free internet, comfortable bed. The shower and toilet are behind frosted glass enclosure, so you can't be too shy with your traveling companion. There was an event and live music that night so the hotel was abuzz with activity. We could hear a little of the noise, but quickly got used to it and slept soundly. Breakfast in the cafe was basic, excellent coffee and reasonably priced. Jonathan and the staff at the Drake are the best. Welcoming, friendly and helpful, what a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley spectacular”
Reviews.Author: WasagaBeachMax
Reviews.Content: The Drake far exceeded our expectations - the staff are what make it so special - never have we been treated so well by so many - we felt like VIP's every day - from check in to dining experiences to enjoying a drink at the bar - everyone treated us like royalty and THAT is rare these days especially with such a young staff. The hotel is retro at its very best - the room was adorable and plush - the bed and linens perfect - the toiletries gorgeous. Being guests and being able to wander from venue to venue within the hotel with our cocktails in tow was so much fun...about as close to a celebrity as we will ever get. Jonathan and his staff are THE best hosts in the city and the hotel, THE Grande Dame of all hotels - it is a destination itself! Cheers guys - can't wait for our next stay!

Reviews.Title: “Jonathan for Prime Minister!”
Reviews.Author: tanda89
Reviews.Content: It has been said here time and again and now we know for ourselves: This place is a gem! My husband Adam and I stayed at the Drake from the 18th until the 22nd of October and had a more than wonderful stay! Our room was fabulous (we stayed in the suite) and the meals and ambiance (in the cafe in the mornings as well as in the lounge in the evenings) were extraordinary! I loved the granola & fruit, Adam leaned to the muffins for breakfast and we both very much enjoyed the Temaki for dinner! The staff is very down to earth and a relief (!) in comparison to other hotels. As far as exploring downtown: ask the staff for some tokens for the streetcar and subway and off you go. The streetcar has its own stop right in front of the hotel and the TTC is very user friendly as we found out. We will most certainly come back to this hotel on our next visit to Toronto! ps I hope the friendly flght attendant on board our return flight to Amsterdam will follow up on our advice and take his husband to the Drake some time soon....! @Jonathan: Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room size”
Reviews.Author: cmfan814
Reviews.Content: I hardly wrote trip advisor review though I am heavy user but I need to do this hotel since it is far below my expectation. We stayed at the hotel last week. I have not visited Toronto for 15 years so that I chose this hotel purely by its ranking. The room size is probably the smallest in comparison with all hotel rooms I stayed in last 25 years neglecting its 200 price tag. Its location is not at the major Queens Street and it doesn't have a elevator.

Reviews.Title: “SO worth it!”
Reviews.Author: mommabare
Reviews.Content: This hotel was definitely more expensive than what we're used to staying in, but it was totally worth it! The staff were courteous and the rooms were simply amazing. We will DEFINITELY bring our business back!

Reviews.Title: “The Drake Hotel Is AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: Lyndsi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently traveled to Toronto and stayed at The Drake Hotel. This hotel was a little pricier than we would normally spend ($189 for a small room), but it was definitely worth the splurge! We are both artists and love art, so this hotel was a perfect choice for us. The Drake has a lot to offer with their ammenities, artistic decor, free dinner (the Staving Artist Buffet was delicious), and free live music. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are looking for somewhere that is hip, cool, artistic, and fun. They even have an ice cream scoop shop and general store next door. The hotel is also in a great area of Toronto too. This is one of my all time favorite hotels now!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, fancy and pricey”
Reviews.Author: Anntrips
Reviews.Content: We visit Toronto often as my husband's family lives nearby but this trip we wanted to stay a few nights in Toronto. We loved the design of the hotel, however we found the rooms to be a bit small for the price we paid. Getting into the hotel at night was a bit of a problem as we found out the lobby turns into a night club.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Completely Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: weezeroo
Reviews.Content: Our first stay at the Drake was just for one night. The couple we traveled with thought they, too, made a reservation at the Drake (months in advance)â€¦however, after my wife & I checked in, our friends realized they never completed their own reservation. We also learned the Drake was fully booked for that night. The manager on arrival, Jonathan LeClaire, was the one who checked my wife & I in. Rather than abandoning our friends who didn't have a reservation, he took it upon himself to start calling other properties trying to secure a room for them. He was able to get them a room at another great property & provided us their confirmation & a map to get them there. He actually sent the 4 of us into the Drakeâ€™s lounge while he worked to find our friends their room. In addition to being such a huge help, he refused to let us pay for the drinks. This was all within 15 minutes of our arrival and was an indication of the amazing service we would enjoy throughout our short stay. The propertyâ€™s spaces are amazing â€“ both the public ones and the guest room we had. We enjoyed the main Lounge, Cafe & the Sky Yard during our stay â€“ the Tiki Bar @ the Sky Yard has 4 stools which the 4 of us grabbed & enjoyed for quite a while, with a great bartender. The hotel became more busy as the night went on, but all the hotel staff went above and beyond to make sure hotel guests bypassed any line, anywhere. Weâ€™ll be back in Toronto for the Waterfront Marathon in a few weeks. Regrettably, we wonâ€™t stay at the Drake. Itâ€™s about 2 miles or so from the downtown start and, while our guestroom was amazing in our last stay, the residual noise we heard there wouldnâ€™t be the best for us the night before the race. I know, though, weâ€™ll be missing the amazing service we quickly grew to love during our 1 night at the Drake & we'll be back some time after the marathon.

Reviews.Title: “The Drake - I'll see you next summer!”
Reviews.Author: MegC88
Reviews.Content: I reserved a "crashpad" at the Drake for the weekend of my boyfriend's birthday. The wonderful staff not only honored my request that we be situated in one of the rooms with an exposed brick wall (they just looked so nice on the website), they had a small balloon bouquet next to the handmade dolls they keep in every room on the bed when we arrived. They were always happy to greet us, no matter what time day or night, and made sure we got into the hotel quickly when there were lines for whatever artists they were hosting that evening. The space is simultaneously, comforting, surprising, stimulating, and efficient. If you're reading this review, you've probably already looked at their website. The pictures don't lie; it really is that eclectic and sophisticated inside. The sky bar was a fantastic leisurely space, where we met a great guy, Tyler, who seemed genuinely happy to suggest things we should do while in the area. Best suggestion? Rent a bike from the hotel to ride out to Lake Ontario with a picnic basket. I'd like to say that we did and it was wonderful, but it rained all the next day - however, the OPTION is sensational and Ben and I have planned to go back next summer. The djs that they had performing the weekend we were there were great, and the crowd was fun. STAY AT THIS HOTEL. IT HELPED MAKE THE BEST WEEKEND TRIP OF MY LIFE.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Drake!”
Reviews.Author: bkg
Reviews.Content: Just made our first trip to Toronto visiting friends, all 4 of us staying at The Drake. What a great hotel, what great staff. We were the oldest by far (all in our early 60's) but we felt right at home in this bohemian paradise. No, the hotel is not for everyone. Quirky rooms, quirkier bathrooms. But we loved it. The rooftop bar is fun, the decor is eclectic (to say the least), and the crowd is young and trendy. Has a little outdoor cafe, a diner, a pretty formal dining room, as well as a club in the basement that is obviously the place to be on Saturday night. It's located in a section of Toronto that is undergoing a revitalization. If you loved the Village when you thought you could still afford it, The Drake is the place for you. Mick Jagger has stayed there and I'm sure fit right in. We will never stay anywhere else in Toronto. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay anywhere else in Toronto!”
Reviews.Author: sleanne87
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here in June, and could not reccomend it highly enough! Firstly, the staff were amazingly friendly and helpful, we arrived hours early for check in, and they accomadated us very quickly. The rooms are quirky (what others have said about the bathrooms is true) but the Drake is a completely unique experience. It's not a bland chain hotel that is souless, it's a perfect place for a city escape! We can not commend the service or the hotel highly enough!! We ate in the outside street retaurant both for breakfast and dinner, and the food was excellent on both occasions. This is a popular eaterie and bar for locals, which speaks for itself. All in all look no further for a unique eye-opening experience! Saty in the Drake, we certainly will upon out return!

Reviews.Title: “We were welcomed warmly and genuinely. It...”
Reviews.Author: geoffgreta
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed warmly and genuinely. It is a special thing to feel like personal guests. Johnathan coordinated our stay with aplomb. Jeff served us on the Sky Deck and both his humor and drink recommendations were spot on. Mark, our bartender, remembered us by name when we returned to the Drake's lounge the next evening, putting us at ease and on par with hip regulars.
