We listened to some gritty live music in The Underground and fell asleep in our utterly quiet "crash pad" while other guests played on. There is so much more than this review mentions. We love culture, campy art, and great service, so we love The Drake.

Reviews.Title: “Art lovers valhalla and they make everyone feel like a VIP!”
Reviews.Author: susiect
Reviews.Content: Arriving by car was confusing as there didn't seem to be a good place to stop due to the bus stop in front of the1890's, recently superbly modernized, hotel in this trendy urban setting. BUT a quick call to the front desk sent the hotel manager, Jonathan, running down the street to rescue me, direct me to the self parking lot, assisting with luggage all the while pouring on the charm and humour! My friend and I were quickly checked in by the friendly efficient front desk staff and we were shown to our respective rooms ( the "Crash Pads") which were on the second of three walk up floors. Our rooms were a lesson in how to live perfectly in a small space. They are articulately designed and well appointed with Queen beds. Original art in every room is just the tip of the extensive art on display in revolving art shows. The lounge, the restaurant, the roof top bar and the cafe all had a great vibe and were the weekend hub for the art crowd. Every member of the staff had a smile and a hello and a personal quip as we walked in and out, making us feel as if we were visiting a place we belonged in. I would definitely stay here again and in fact this hotel and the staff makes me want to find a reason to go back to Toronto very soon.

Reviews.Title: “I Love the Drake!”
Reviews.Author: MJaneMiller
Reviews.Content: What a nice change of pace for business travel! Though not for anyone looking for swimming, hot tubs or fitness centers, there are plenty of activities right in the hotel. Yoga is available on the sky deck if you need organized exercise. I love the feeling I get when I walk in the lobby -- it has a real soul and heartbeat, and a feeling of rich history. The atmosphere inspires creativity and playfulness. The staff is excellent -- Johnathon is the best hotel manager I've ever met! They're all so attentive and helpful. Do yourself a favor and stay at The Drake on your next trip to Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “The Drake gets it.”
Reviews.Author: muddymiss
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel they checked us in EARLY. Then, the concierge went way out of his way to successfully help us find parking. He could have just told us about the public parking lot nearby and washed his hands of it. Instead, he ran to another parking lot to try to set us up and then found a secret spot near construction where we were able to park the whole stay for free. Everyone that works there is down-to-earth, beautiful(inside and out) and genuinely happy to help. The breakfast in their restaurant was great, especially their on-site baked scones. The patio was chill for drinks or coffee. One negative is that I felt the dinner menu was slightly overpriced. I can't see paying $17-$18 for a cheeseburger but the lunch and breakfasts were great. The beds are super comfortable, the showers are great, the in-room guest service catalog rules. We were there for NXNE so The Drake's club(s) were bumping til way in the AM but surprisingly we couldn't hear a thing from our room. The morning we left town the restaurant wasn't open until 11 AM but they let us sit and served us breakfast at 7:30AM anyways. Seriously, they made us feel taken care of the entire time. Spend the extra few bucks and be treated like a house guest instead of a customer and stay at the Drake. You can safely plan your trip around your stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A bit too steeply priced”
Reviews.Author: erikdangermoose
Reviews.Content: A good boutique hotel, but the price do not match the size of the room. It is also a bit irritating that the trendiness has taken over and the room is made so that you practically sit on an altar when you go to the "restroom", which is not really a restroom, but a part of the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: parashan
Reviews.Content: Came into the hotel a little apprehensive, because I thought we might not be "cool" enough and felt a little old (late 40s). But we were immediately put at ease with the sincere friendliness and assistance upon check-in with the staff and managers. They seemed to sense our anxiety and suggested we unwind in the lounge with 2 free drinks coupons. We are both extensive business travelers familiar with the conventional Holiday Inn or Hilton experience, but this was such a welcome change! I loved the bohemian feel of our "den" and found the setup of the bathroom and shower to be truly unique and fun! We went to the lounge and had some scrumptious sushi with our tasty drinks and set out to see some of the sights of Toronto. Upon our return, there was a line of people waiting to get in, but as hotel guests, we were quickly and easily escorted in and told to enjoy any of the venues freely. Went up to the trendy rooftop bar for a nightcap and then headed back to our room. The hotel was full of people from the roof to the basement enjoying the array of entertainment, but we were not bothered with any outside noise. Hated to leave and wished we had another day, but I look forward to the return!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, crappy restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Little_Boot
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the Drake are lovely, but the one I got was totally mismatched to the lovely old exterior of the building. It had a distinctly "Ikea furniture," vibe. BUT... each are unique. They're designed by local artistes, apparently. The beds were comfy and the room came with a really nice flatscreen TV and DVD player. I don't have many complaints about the room, other than the fact that we could hear some music playing in the evening. It's fairly pricey for the location - it's not in the downtown core, not near a subway, and close to the slightly-seedy Dufferin Mall area. But you ARE getting an old-fashioned hotel, not a run-of-the-mill Ramada type deal (the layout itself is pretty neat). The hotel staff were polite and efficient. But the restaurant is horrendous. I made the mistake of eating lunch there, and ended up with an unidentifiable chunk of - charcoal? I really couldn't tell - in my food. No apology from Waitress - she didn't have to care, as there was a 19% mandatory tip on the lunch special we got. The room was filled with noisy older ladies who dressed in uber-tight Le Chateau duds. It really didn't scream hip... more midlife crisis. Anyhow, if you love unusual old buildings and unique decor (and understand the Toronto streetcar system), I'd recommend the place. It just wasn't for me.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgetable Hotel with great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Carolinelikesthesun
Reviews.Content: If you are visiting Toronto, there is only one hotel you really want to stay! Great atmosphere and incredible service. It's a relief to see that places like this exist. In my opinion so much nicer than the typical international chains. Due to the ash cloud we had to stay somewhat longer than foreseen. It was the best place in Toronto to spend some overtime. This is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. If you like the typical international 4-5 star hotels (where I usually stay for business), don't stay at the Drake. If you are in for a great hotel experience = please don't hesitate.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy rooms, great restaurants and bar”
Reviews.Author: Ivonne33
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Toronto on business, I had read fabulous comments about this venue and its personable service. The hotel itself met my expectations, however, I did not feel the staff was as friendly, i had trouble with the wifi service, i reported it and had a hard time getting answers from them. Other than that The Drake hotel is indeed a mix of vintage and modern style and its deco is outstanding, I loved the glass shower in the room, bed was comfy, and although the hotel bar gets packed during the weekends I had no trouble falling asleep. Room service was efficient, and breakfast served in my room was delicious, fresh baked muffins were yummy and fresh squeezed OJ was the best. I had dinner in the Hotel sushi bar and I loved it aswell, the wine variety in the bar was not the best but we still enjoyed a bottle while watching the academy awards. The hotel is located in a nice funky neighborhood, ideal for shopping and walks. There are many good restaurants withing walking distance. Another plus was the shower ammenities, specially the hair conditioner!! Overall the experience was very nice, when I am back in Toronto, I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cool without the attitude!”
Reviews.Author: spr248
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two fabulous nights at the Drake... the service couldn't have been better. We arrived late, and although the hotel's restaurant was about to close, the woman at the front desk made sure we got in and got fed. The food was so good we ate two more meals there! The room was fun and young, with ample space and lots of character. The hotel is located in a really great part of Toronto, filled with restaurants and shops, and it's an easy (though somewhat lengthy) walk from the hotel into downtown. We would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The coolest hotel with the best staff ever”
Reviews.Author: Mark_J_G
Reviews.Content: Rooms - just so cool, really different and fun. Excellent. Bar - fantastic. Staff - the best. They really cannot do enough for you. You often hear peopl say this, but it has never been more true. My favourite hotel in North America (and I have stayed in 100s!) by a mile.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Pad!”
Reviews.Author: gaylerach
Reviews.Content: I actually created a previous review for this hotel. Honestly, it's awesome! Plate glass shower next to the bed.... saucey pulp fiction in the DVD player.... jazz on the stereo.... What could be better?

Reviews.Title: “Stay at The Drake”
Reviews.Author: Kristi22
Reviews.Content: We were greeted pleasantly the moment we stepped into The Drake. Personalized service is a fabulous trait they have mastered. Our questions were answered. Destinations given with directions and a map. The accomodations were a pleasant surprise as were the dining and nightlife located in The Drake.

Reviews.Title: “not only an hotel: just the place you want to stay in”
Reviews.Author: francojul
Reviews.Content: for those who look for a living and friendly place, who are fed up with international anonymous business class hotel, who prefer real CafÃ©, Lounge Bar and Restaurant with real local people instead of boring hotel bar. Only 22 rooms, WITH A STYLE, you feel like an authentic guest, not anonymous customer. Evening and night are exciting, why would you go elsewhere when the rest of the city comes to the Drake?

Reviews.Title: “Remember that scene in "Almost Famous"?”
Reviews.Author: GCLeigh
Reviews.Content: Ok.... so, you are looking for the 1970s rock-n-roll hotel experience but you realize that you are (a) not a rock star, (b) on a tight budget, and (c) living in the wrong era. But, you are going to be in Toronto! Make a reservation at The Drake Hotel any time of the year and you are going to have an outstanding experience. We stayed in one of their "Crash Pads" and ordered the cognac rose petal turn-down service to celebrate my husband's birthday. By the time we returned from our evening dinner reservations, the night caps were warming under the amber desk lamp and our bed was littered with red and pink rose petals. Along with the in-room plate glass shower, the bass pumping up through our mattress and pillows from the basement club, and the party-girls falling down in the hall outside our room, the entire experience made us feel like we should call our roadies to carry down our luggage for check-out in the morning. Quick tip though, parking was tricky and even though we paid for a reserved spot, we still ended up parking on the street; which resulted in a $28 ticket. Thankfully, the staff eagerly refunded our parking fee....maybe if we had an agent we could have arranged for the hotel to pay for our ticket, too. Truly, we had a most excellent time!

Reviews.Title: “Best City Centre Boutique Hotel I've Stayed At”
Reviews.Author: jarvischas
Reviews.Content: This is the second time in two years we've stayed at the Drake. Each time for 10 days, and we have not been disappointed once. This time we stayed in the only Suite which is quirky and very comfortable. However the hanging space for clothes is greater in the large rooms. From booking the hotel the service from the front desk was fabulous. All staff are friendly and helpful, and willing to go that extra mile. In the resturant I noticed there was a desert wine by one of my favourite producers, on mentioning this to the waiter, a few minutes later I was presented with a sample to try. Similarly on our last night whilst dining in the bistro after chatting with the waiter he found out it was my 40th B'day the day before and bought me the desert and coffees. etc. All this helps to make this a memorable stay and yet again the bechmark hotel for city centre boutique hotels. If I did have to quibble its how Torontonians like to use the hotel themselves, and some times one or more of the three faboulous bars, and two restaurants may be out of bounds to guests due to private marketing events. (well it was the week before Christmas so we should expect it) However that should not let you spoil your stay as there are plenty of places to go on Ossignton, further west down in Parkdale (I do have to give a big shout out to the Local Kitchen and Wine Bar on 1710 Queen West, brilliant food and atmosphere) or more mainstream on Queen West.

Reviews.Title: “The Little Luxery Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tonup69
Reviews.Content: The Drake was fantastic. All of the staff are painfully happy and young and gracious. There are several very hip clubs and bars in the hotel so there is always a line out front, but hotel guests are always allowed in first, so it really makes you feel like a VIP. The rooms are simple, retro and quiet, believe it or not. The cafe on the ground floor is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience. My Fav TO place to sleep.”
Reviews.Author: Monopoly83
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one weekend in August 09'. We booked the Medium Sized Den. And also in the smaller crashpad a few years back. Check-in/out was a breeze and fast. Staff is really amazing and friendly. Our room was not exactly your typical hilton hotel layout as you can see from the pictures posted. It feels warm and comfortable and the beds were really nice as well. A little on the small side but for two adults its perfect for a weekend getaway. SUPER clean as well. The Hotel is just awesome with so many activites going on. The friday there was so much going on at night we didn't even leave the place. Two Dj's spinning on the main lobby, indie band in the basement, skybar was loaded with people so we thought there was no point in searching elsewhere outside the place. Plus an art show with some interesting. The Coffeeshop at the side has a great selection of all sorts in the morning. definately worth checking out. Sure it's more expensive than your typical nice hotel but you just can't beat the design and work put into this place. Its also farther down on Queen St W. away from most of the nightlife if thats what your into. But several art displays, small restaurants worth checking out. I'll definately be staying here again next summer. You can't beat the service and overall feel of this place!

Reviews.Title: “Funky, Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkPetey
Reviews.Content: We were excited about this hotel because it seems like there isn't much to offer in the way of funky hotels in Toronto. The funkiness was great, but we were disappointed with the rooms. They were just too small to be comfortable. The staff were friendly (what else would you expect from Canadians?) and the location was ok. I would recommend this for someone looking for a different style.

Reviews.Title: “Drake is hip AND good”
Reviews.Author: jbroder
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Drake for two nights with a wedding party. This place was hip AND good, a rare combination. Three venue locations within the hotel for night life make this a geat fit for night life lovers. The staff was helpful,friendly, and on their game. Food was great. In house event planning and attention to detail was also first class. Can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Very vibey, very cool...”
Reviews.Author: plusfour
Reviews.Content: I checked into The Drake for a single night, on my own on the way through Toronto after the friend I was supposed to be staying with turned out to be in China. And it was a pretty good result... The hotel is very, very cool. Small (only 19 rooms) and trendy (think mismatched vintage furniture) but excellent service, friendly staff, a very comfy bed and a location in a cool part of town - all hip bars, fashionable restaurants, clothing boutiques and vintage furniture shops. I stayed in a 'crash pad' which was tiny, but enough for me for a night. It would have got decidedly claustrophobic for more than a night or with someone else, but for this purpose it was fine, if a little expensive (although it was the last night of the Toronto Film Festival, so maybe that was to be expected). It was a slightly odd trip, as I was in transit to the US and didn't have much time in town, but The Drake is a cool hotel - backed up with the 'cool hotel' books it's featured in sitting around the room. It would definitely be a serious contender if I came back to Toronto, but if I was travelling with someone else, it would have to be a bigger room and they get kind of expensive...

Reviews.Title: “I love it, I love it, I love it!”
Reviews.Author: Have_fun_will_travel
Reviews.Content: I was despondent to leave the hip, quirky environs of The Drake. I loved everything about this place -- the location in a funky arts district, the original art in every room, the small size (19 rooms, I think), the fact that a wonderful coffee shop/resto is on the ground floor and an open-air bar/resto is on level 2, but mostly I loved the staff. Young, fashionable and refreshingly free of attitude. Very knowledgeable and quick to help. When was the last time you stayed in a hotel with a curator on staff? The Drake has one. I'm a 40-something traveler who was apprehensive about the noise level after reading some reviews on this site. I needn't have worried. I was there three nights while parties related to the Toronto International Film Festival raged below me. I slept like a log all three nights -- tho' I did use earplugs one night. I wouldn't think of going to Toronto and staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Small, comfortable room, but beware the club below”
Reviews.Author: Yellowlab3944
Reviews.Content: Nice staff, comfortable room. The bath is open to the room, so if you are traveling with someone you should be comfortable using toilet/showering/etc in front of them (ie, OK with partner, but not necessarily your daughter). Great room service meal from the restaurant. Only complaint is the noise from the club. This is more of a hipster/after-hours scene than a business hotel

Reviews.Title: “delicious food”
Reviews.Author: lupe31
Reviews.Content: Delectable lunch at the Bistro served by the charming employee. Eugenio not only suggested a good meal that he also offered to help us find the best restaurant in town, and ...he did. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Drake staff is exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: RutaBagaCalgary
Reviews.Content: Rooms are efficiently compact, full of electronic toys and creatively decorated. A pillow menu would add to the comfort of the bed. Depending on the location of the room, earplugs may be necessary. Lots of nightlife in the Hotel and the neighbourhood. Meals in the Hotel were excellent. The staff is exceptional; their enthusiasm makes the stay at the Drake very memorable.

Reviews.Title: “A Quirky, Delightful, Wonderful, Warm Place to Stay... The Drake”
Reviews.Author: vjboaz
Reviews.Content: It was our second time at the Drake. We visited there in October of 2008. In spite of the length of time since our last visit, we were greeted like old friends. Jonathan and Zoe at the front desk are in a word, delightful. We arrived in late morning and were able to check in within an hour. In the meantime, we had a delectable lunch at the Bistro in the hotel and were served by Eugenio. He was charming and attentive. When we mentioned that we needed to find a restaurant for dinner - he gave us directions and recommendations that resulted in the best Italian dinner we have ever had. The next evening we had dinner at the Drake's restaurant. and were greeted by Al, who also remembered us from our previous stay. The quality of the food was only exceeded by the service. The quirky decor, the cleanliness, the charm and warmth of the staff, the quality of the food all contributed to making the Drake Hotel our favorite hotel anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “From Service to Food to Decor, The Drake Hotel is Unmatched and Unequaled”
Reviews.Author: 111sushiluver111
Reviews.Content: The best way to begin this review is to tell the story of how my fiancÃ© and I fell in love with the Drake Hotel, but for those of you who are pressed for time I will summarize our impressions first. The Drake is an intimate, classy, elegant and gorgeous place. The rooms are cozy, impeccably clean, comfortable, and absolutely beautiful. The entire atmosphere, from the restaurant to the rooms, is the sought-after mixture of sophistication and relaxation that so many establishments strive for but few ever attain. The staff is friendly and heartwarmingly helpful, so much so that if you can treat them like people instead of employees you will find that they become friends by the end of your stay. Weâ€™ve stayed in a great many of the best hotels across the Caribbean, the United States, Canada, and Europe, and cannot recommend any of them more highly than the Drake Hotel. Now for the long version of our experience. I was planning my proposal evening, and since we lived a fair distance away from Toronto, I needed a place for me and my newly-engaged girlfriend to stay in. Cost was no object; I wanted the evening to be magical and perfect. I visited every hotel worthy of mention in Toronto, touring their different suites and rooms, inspecting them carefully, but after visiting the Drake none of them remained an option. As a sort of measure of how much the Drake appealed to me: I turned down top-floor suites with sweeping views of downtown Toronto, luxurious multi-room affairs with every amenity imaginable. You see, every hotel I have ever visited in has a faint aroma of bureaucratic coldness that lingers in the air, no matter how hard they try to cover it up. Not so at the Drake. For the first time, I felt at home in a hotel. I felt like I could relax, chat with the staff, or lounge in the lobby. The actual environment, from the lobby on up to the rooms, is disarming, and it begins to work its magic as soon as you pass through the large glass doors of the hotel. After being pleasantly surprised at how helpful the manager was, and at how far they were willing to go to accommodate my many preparatory requests, I booked one of their Salon rooms. As one caveat, the design of the rooms is definitely most suitable for couples. There is little in the way of private space, and the clear shower walls mean that only the romantically involved or the supremely comfortable will be able to room together. As for our actual stay, it could not have gone better. The staff went above and beyond the call of duty to make us feel welcome, to ensure that everything went perfectly, and even that we felt loved. When our arranged taxi was late, the manager went out into the winter street in a tee-shirt to rustle up another. After we departed, he called the restaurant and arranged to have our reservation held for us. The room was beautifully decorated and gloriously snug. The bed was very comfortable, and the complimentary designer toiletries and shampoos were delightful (in particular, the mint shampoo is an experience in itself). The room also includes an Ipod dock with speakers and a CD player. The room is extremely well-designed, and despite the fact that they look small in pictures can contain more than four large suitcases without feeling at all cramped. The Drake also offers an astounding number of extras for a special occasion, which I took advantage of. Lilies awaited us in the room when we first arrived and when we returned from dinner rose petals were scattered about the room and in the shape of a heart on the bed. Plates of delicious chocolates and other sweets were also waiting. The rooms are lit with a number of halogen lights, which can be individually adjusted for lighting ranging from bright and cheerful to low and romantic. The room itself was spotlessly clean, and featured a number of mirrors (a fact which my girlfriend -> fiancÃ© appreciated enormously). The morning after, we descended the central staircase to smiles and applause from the staff and were then treated to complimentary mimosas. We spent much of the morning in the restaurant, where we enjoyed a wonderful breakfast, fresh oysters, and the wide view of Queen Street. The windows in the restaurant face the morning sun, and the red velvet divan was sinfully comfortable. As a side note, the food was excellent. The oysters were as fresh as I have ever tasted (I am something of an addict, if not an aficionado, for seafood of all kinds), the eggs and bacon were delicious, and the Drakeâ€™s Mojitos are superb. All in all, I cannot overstress how wonderful the Drake is. It is truly a unique and unrivaled gem, and there is literally nothing besides its early check-out times (11 or 12 in the morning) that I can complain about. It is a fantastic, amazing place that stands head and shoulders above its competitors on an international level. It is not for nothing that it is listed by many reputable travel magazines as one of the best hotels in the world. I can vouch for the conclusion that the Drake Hotel is one of the finest romantic hotels in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: ilikedat
Reviews.Content: What can I say...the Drake is by far the best place I have ever stayed. From the minute I made the reservation, I knew this was a great place. Zoe was so friendly and helpful, Stephanie at the desk knew my name when I walked in the door, Jonathan...love him! We stayed in the "music room", and it was totally awsome! The bed was great *wink*, the open glass shower...*hot*...they had everything that you could possibly need in the room. The staff did everything for us including getting tix to Second City! There are plenty of things to do within walking distance of the hotel, and if you need to go a little further, you can catch a street car right out front. Next time I am in Toronto, the Drake is where I'll be! The staff is genuine and they really do care that you are enjoying yourself and will do whatever they need to do to make sure your stay is the best possible. Drake staff....love you!!!

Reviews.Title: “wierd mixed reaction: fun but don't go if you want to sleep”
Reviews.Author: louie60
Reviews.Content: I think this is the best hotel in TO. Small, unique, loved the details, and just an almost perfect package.... But!!! If you think you are going to be able to sleep at any point if there is a band downstairs forget it. Just a tip for those who aren't a partying crowd. Not a wink was possible. Bring ear plugs. Perfect for young guests. I think I am just over the past 2 in the morning crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, fantastic vibe and am definetly coming back!”
Reviews.Author: jmignonac
Reviews.Content: I genuinely think this hotel has the complete package. I spent 5 days there and was sad to say goodbye. The rooms were impeccable, the staff were adorable and it's the place to be if you're up for having fun on a daily basis. The cafe, restaurant, and sky deck are a perfect match for the hotel and I was always torn in which place to hang out. nothing was ever a problem and I will be happy to call this place my mobile home when in Toronto next time

Reviews.Title: “Yeah, I dug it.”
Reviews.Author: coxsone
Reviews.Content: The Drake is a great little hotel with a LOT of people coming in and out of it. There's a bar, restaurant or nightclub on every floor, it seems yet amazingly, the rooms are really quiet. Our room was VERY small, but really stylish. It was essentially comfy, but there's only really the bed. FYI: we had a shower that had no privacy at all. Maybe no problem for couples, but if you're with someone who you don't want to essentially be naked around, ask what the other rooms are like when you book. We were in the smallest of the rooms (the Crashpad). It's pretty pricey, but hipness costs. The thing about the Drake is that everyone who works there is beautiful and also (coming from big cities in the US, especially) ridiculously nice. The skybar was fun, the nightclub was packed and playing Prince. (We didn't do the other bar.) NB: I only gave service three stars b/c although they were nice, you have to call downstairs to get almost anything. That's fine, but when we were there they seemed to only have one person--the desk person--doing everything. And that person is busy, so you may have to wait a *really* long time for anything you ask for. We were there for romance, and it was our kind of romantic (so I'm clicking "Romance" on the trip description). Others may want more lushness for their romance. However, we loved it, though and will be back. P.S. Check out the Bata shoe museum in Toronto. We went not expecting much--we were nearby and needed to kill an hour and a half--and were surprisingly engaged by it.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best experience I've ever had at a hotel. Ever.”
Reviews.Author: alobarish
Reviews.Content: From the first check in, to the room, to the restaurant, incredible service, great venue, great people, great music, great food. The room was on the small side (crash pad), but it was perfect for me and I had no problem with it - maybe a small stool would have been good, but seriously, I felt so at home and comfortable both there and in the bar, that it made this the first time I've ever liked toronto. Avoid the stale, bland hotels like the hilton and the westin - and go for the drake. Even la germaine, which was probably nicer in decor, couldn't come close to the comfort and friendliness and service and just feel of "this place is amazing" that the drake had. Thanks to everyone there, and I will be back next week (the 29th and 30th) to enjoy more of your excellent hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous”
Reviews.Author: heathside
Reviews.Content: The Drake is like going to stay with friends, except better. Friendly, helpful, informal, vibrant, good food and a lovely room to crash in. Why go elsewhere?

Reviews.Title: “quirky and cool”
Reviews.Author: alicadden
Reviews.Content: This place is different to the other hotels in Toronto and I loved it. The atmosphere is laid back and cool. The area ia a bit shabby: arty farty, vintage clothes shops, vietnamese restaurants and second hand appliacne outlets - a refreshing change from the shiny bits in the city centre. The design features make it pretty special - check out the rag dolls is the rooms, the light fitting in the cafe made from old bike frames and the various bits of artwork dotted around the place. The room service menus are unique! It's the only place I want to stay in Toronto from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Vintage Hotel”
Reviews.Author: katdvine
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Drake as part of a romantic weekend for my boyfriend and myself. The place was beautiful with a unique feel. It had friendly and helpful staff and with entertainment built into the place, the lounge and the underground its almost a one stop shop. It can be really busy on a weekend night but overall is was great. A word for the traveler, the bathrooms are almost entirely glass with just a little shaded door to possibly cover you while you are in the shower or toilet. It could be quite the "intimate" experience for you and your guest if you know what I mean. Overall, i would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent night. Cannot wait to go back.”
Reviews.Author: eayoga
Reviews.Content: The Drake surpassed our expectations. We expected parking troubles, but it turned out there was a municipal lot across the street which only cost $6 for 12 hours -- cheap by Toronto hotel standards. We arrived an hour or so before check in and planned to have lunch at the bar to wait it out. The bar staff was friendly and chatty -- even though they were swamped on what turned out to be 'Family Day,' a new Canadian holiday. The bartender poured an excellent Guinness. Not only was the room ready before we finished lunch, but the super staff also upgraded us from a 'crashpad' to a 'den' without our even asking. The staff was great, the room very cool -- and quiet. Overall, a fabulous Toronto get-a-way.

Reviews.Title: “Who Doesn't Love The Drake?”
Reviews.Author: NKBurlington
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Drake for our anniversary - which just happens to fall on the TIFF weekend. We made our way to the Raw Bar then headed to The Underground then we partied atop the Sky Yard Bar. Fantastic. Tons of people, lots of fun. Once the bartenders and wait staff knew we were guests at the hotel, they treated us like gold. They were very attentive and took special care to ensure our needs were looked after - even though there were hundreds of other people there for the film festival. Being guests at the hotel during the festival garnered us special access to the bars and restaurants during the festival. People were lined up outside waiting to get in but we had access and came and went as we pleased. It was quite fun. Our room was amazing. Small but unique. We loved the open concept of the room. We ordered one of the "Pleasure Paks" and had a blast in our room before headed out for more drinks and dancing. In short, if you're looking for a unique, fun, sexy weekend, The Drake is the place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Only at the Drake”
Reviews.Author: alpereric
Reviews.Content: What do you call a hotel that gives you the warmest, most genuine welcome you've encountered in your travels? What do you call a hotel where the staff are actually people you want to talk to rather than automatons that simply go through the motions? What do you call a hotel where the rooms have character in addition to four walls and a bed? What do you call a hotel that willingly gives you a laptop charger when you've forgotten your own? And what do you call a hotel that's more than a hotel; a place with a soul, a story and a presence all its own? I call it the Drake and as a guest who stayed there on the evening November 26th, I can see myself returning. And an extra congratulations to Jonathan at the front desk for helping create an outstanding experience.

Reviews.Title: “major player in one of my best days ever”
Reviews.Author: messysee
Reviews.Content: First things, Ana the hotel manager and Jonathan the front desk manager are two extremely shiny gems in a forest of dirty dusty coal in the world of hotels. This is one small attempt to thank them (belatedly) for the help and assistance in arranging for flowers, contingency plans, and a wonderful night with great care and diligence. I arrived to this hotel with my fiance of several hours, wet and fairly exhausted after the several hours of driving, also glowing and newly in on "the big secret". This hotel had about 8 staff that I personally interacted with. All of them--and I used to work the front desk of a hotel--*all gave superior service. The sommelier provided my sweetie Steven extra and enthusiastic knowledge for the engagement night bubbly. Jonathan worked with Steven and his groomsman to coordinate arrival and help keep the big secret for dinner and a possible late evening proposal. The entire staff, including the restaurant, seemed aware of the engagement, taking an interest and offering a little extra effort to make us feel welcome and pampered. Never mind that the room (think space allocation of a Manhattan apartment, with very good chic) was comfortable, nicely adorned, and romantic. When we figured out the lights (forgot to pay attention when entering the room), the unique bathing and toilet, the facilities, tiles and colors worked well for us. Bed was soft and comfy, breakfast (beautifully on the house as a gift from Ana) delish, and dinner very very nice. Also, dessert came up to the room for us, when I mentioned I was beat at the dinner table. Two things to bear in mind, but not hold against the hotel, are that rooms require a flight of stairs and parking is not a good idea. When we left there after our one night, I felt as though the Drake Hotel was holding onto a piece of a day that would not have been the same without it. I was reluctant to go. I think of it now, and it is a really excellent boutique hotel, but the people in it are the real stars. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “great place for 20-something citydwellers”
Reviews.Author: typetraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Drake for 2 day, and it really made my weekend memorable. I stayed in room 207 (the crash pad), which was a small but beautiful room. Being someone who lives in a very small studio apartment, I thought they really made GREAT use of the space. On my last night, it was too cold and rainy to go out, so I stayed in and watched a movie and I felt like I was at home. The staff downstairs was very helpful, and were always eager to help â€”Â they gave perfect directions to the airport using the mass transit (which only costs me 2.75 where a cab ride would have been 40-50 dollars). The Hotel is right near the 24 hour streetcar on Queen Street, which is a hotspot for restaurants, galleries, shopping, and near several ZipCars. For the young Carless city-dwellers, this is a perfect location to stay when visiting Toronto! The only 2 reasons I gave it a 4 out of 5 was because I had to pay a cover charge to get into the bar downstairs (Which I thought was a little lame, especially when I'm staying there). Though the room was very quiet, there was a low buzzing hum you could hear and feel during certain times of the night and the morning in bed that made me grateful that I brought my earplugs with me.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: KikiUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Drake for a few days in a bitterly cold October but the hotel was cosy and comfortable in every way. The entire hotel was beautifully decorated with great pieces of art adding a playful and fun side and making it unique. The design was very clever, masking the small size of the rooms and making them very comfortable and a delight to stay in. The food in the restaurants and cafe was delicious and the semi outdoor skybar on the roof terrace was a great place to end an evening with a projector showing old movies above your head giving the place a very 'cool' ambiance. There is even a small club in the basement, which we didn't have time to check out but it apparently hosts a lot of live bands. We didn't get disturbed by any music though so I presume that they have their sound proofing well sorted out! The staff were all very friendly and helpful, making you feel very at home. It was situated in quite an arty area with loads of great boutiques and it was even possible to walk (approx 1/2 hr) to the city centre. It was also easily accessable by tram. Although this is a slightly pricier hotel ( although it held up well in comparison to other Toronto hotels), we would definitely recommend it and think it was worth every penny. If you want a more memorable stay, somewhere that can be romantic, fun and comfortable, I would say that this is the hotel for you!

Reviews.Title: “Drake Too Techno”
Reviews.Author: TravlinJPA
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my second stay at The Drake. I returned because I like the Toronto Arts District,the fun attitude of the hotel and the nice coffee shop that serves great pastries. There are lots of galleries, museums, shops and eateries up and down Queen Street. My husband and I enjoyed the Drake restaurants and bar the first time around. The second visit I was on my own and was surprised at the change in ambience. The night scene at the Drake was loud and focused on the bar clientele, not the hotel guest. In the evening I had to pass through bar bouncers and lines of wannabe beautiful people to get into the hotel. I wanted to get a late night bite to eat with my son and his girlfriend at the hotel but were forced to look elsewhere because of the techno music was so loud, and permeated all the dining areas. (I am a jazz afficionado, so techno is not my cup of tea...) Still, the service was friendly and helpful. My room was quiet and far removed from the night time fray. I like the hotel, but may choose someplace else next time because it all was a bit tooooo much.

Reviews.Title: “Unique, Bohemian, Exciting, not really me but...”
Reviews.Author: WorldHappy
Reviews.Content: I'm the kind of business woman who stays at the Fairmont, The Ritz, and The Westin. The Drake is as far from those venues as you can imagine. There is no elevator in the three story boutique hotel, the Cafe restaurant is funky and not conducive to meetings, there are only two people running the front desk, and there is a music venue in the basement that attracts mobs on weekends. But I would absolutely stay here again. The 30s, retro atmosphere grows on you, the food is fabulous, the staff of two is welcoming and helpful in a warm kind manner, and the Jazz band in the bar/restaurant on the main floor was wonderful (and the sushi chef talented and creative). The rooms are comfortable and they have an in spa service that got my hair and nails done when I arrived their at 7pm. For someone like me it was a great change of pace--I need to loosen up in life and The Drake is one way for me to do that!

Reviews.Title: “Take us back to the Drake”
Reviews.Author: emcl
Reviews.Content: I booked the Drake Hotel because it sounded interesting and the neighborhood exciting. Usually, we are rather conservative in our choice of hotels, but sometimes adventure is good. However, when we arrived in front of the hotel we were worried that we had chosen wrong. NOT AT ALL! From the moment we walked into the lobby of the Drake, we were happy travelers. The staff was extremely welcoming--mind you, we are probably well beyond the age of the usual guests--and we felt very much appreciated, advised concerning where to go and what to do and where to eat. Our room (they are called "crashpads") was funky and minimal and fun--it was also very comfortable, functional and very clean. We loved the quirky touches and got used to the somewhat revealing bathroom arrangement. I am glad we asked for a room on the second floor on the side of the hotel where it was quiet, because at night the Drake came alive with droves of young people and music. After three nights, we felt like part of the hotel and were recognized by the young staff whenever we appeared. We also got to bypass the bouncer which was exciting. The neighborhood around the Drake is full of galleries, interesting shops and little restaurants that are not pretentious. Fabulous shopping for wool. At the recommendation of the hotel, we ate at the Cowbell on West Queen Street which was small and excellent. Breakfast at the Drake was very good. We will return to the Drake in a flash and are recommending it to our friends who like something out of the ordinary. EMcL

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel experiences EVER...truly”
Reviews.Author: missamyChicago
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure where to start... The Drake Hotel has to be one of the most unique, wonderful, special hotels in all the world...and I've travelled the globe quite a bit. From the moment you walk in you are in design heaven. The design eye and sensibility behind The Drake is evident in every single detail. The lobby, the rooms, the cocktail lounge, the underground bar, the cafe--every single space is a visual delight, the kind that has you oohing and ahhing outloud. And while yes, the look of the hotel is ultra cool--and the vibe backs that up-- the people at The Drake could not be nicer or warmer or more genuine. Go to a spot like this in London or New York and you'd typically find the staff a bit pretentious; this is so not the case here. I think that pairing is what makes this place so fabulous and desirable: uber cool and of-the-moment in its look and hub of activity but wonderful, real, kind, helpful people bringing it all to life. I will definitely return to The Drake; there is nothing like it in the world. You should put it at the top of your list for experiences in this lifetime. Some of the unbelievably amazing people you should look out for and get to know: Jonathan, Zoe and Ana at the front desk; Mia the curator who will show you the hotel's fantastic art; and Anthony in the cafe. signed, Amy from Chicago

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Energy, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: ann160
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place - full of beautiful art, interesting people and the staff is outstanding. Being 64 probably makes me a bit older than their average guest, but I would recommend The Drake to everyone. The energy in this hotel is warm and exciting and the people who work there are extremely helpful and fun! The food is delicious and even in The Cafe the presentation is beautiful. And, the neighborhood is full of art galleries and wonderful small shops. I can't wait to return. Ann

Reviews.Title: “Toronto didn't disappoint, unlike the Drake...”
Reviews.Author: SimoneSW
Reviews.Content: We booked the Drake on the basis of the reviews on TripAdvisor, but having spent a week there, I feel like we stayed in a totally different hotel to the rest of the reviewers. Firstly, the noise. We were in the previously mentioned room 203. I guess we could've ignored being woken every morning at 7.30am by the awnings on the cafe downstairs being opened. But on the first night there was an art event in Toronto called Nuit Blanche, which apparently is a great excuse to pump loud house music into your room until the police arrive at 4.40am to break things up. I rang down at 3.20am to find out how much longer it would last (and informed it'd only be another 20 minutes or so - I'm guessing the 'or so' meant 'add another hour on to that) and request ear plugs, only to be told that they had no earplugs, that there wasn't anything they could do and not actually hear the word 'sorry'. Had we have had some warning or an apology, we'd probably have been fine about it, but with none forthcoming, it was a hardly an auspicious start to our stay. On our last night, mindful of having an overnight flight we went to bed a bit early (midnightish), but at two am had to check the room wasn't being broken into because of the noise of the bar opposite kicking out - believe me, it's not quiet. I do not believe for a second that we're the only ones to complain about the noise in the room if that's the norm. Next, the room. Now it's small, and I appreciate that they're trying to create an illusion of space. The problem comes when to compensate, you need to be the kind of couple who don't mind using the toilet in front of each other, because the toilet (and shower) are glass. Granted, there's a bit of frosting on the toilet door, but you are aware that your loved one is mere centimetres away, and I'm more one for keeping a certain amount of mystery, myself. The dvd player in the room was a nice touch (although I guess that's as much for the 'pleasure menu' users than for our benefit), and handy because the tv wasn't actually tuned in, and most of the channels were fuzz. One night, our blind fell down, which I was really panicked about, but when we went to apologise, we were told it was okay, it was already broken. So shouldn't it have been fixed before your guests arrive, then? As for the menu, during our stay I didn't notice it change once. Furthermore, if you're a vegetarian, you better be fond of grilled cheese sandwiches or mushrooms on toast. Because other than sushi, you won't find much else. Oh and that late night menu that the management previously mentioned - only on a Friday or Saturday. Otherwise, if you ask for a cheese sandwich after 11pm, it's a no go (although some hardcore dvds and a whip would be fine, apparently - I did check for edible undies on the offchance of getting a snack though). The staff - excluding the sweet blonde guy on the front desk - were at best a little frosty. At worst, we were left waiting in the skybar for a menu for a good 40 minutes, before going to grab a waitress ourselves, who proceeded to ask "where'd we come from?!". Hardly the height of efficiency. The rest of the time, you went mostly unacknowledged. We're not prudes by any stretch of the imagination - we were in Toronto to catch some gigs and do some record shopping, we're early 30s, we love staying at the Pellirocco in Brighton (which the Drake appears to have some incredibly similar ideas as - the pleasure menu, the design hotel element, etc). We've stayed at the Roosevelt in LA which has a reputation for being loud loud loud party hotel and loved it, but it also has something that the Drake is seriously lacking - soundproofing in the rooms. I guess the main problem with the Drake is that it doesn't know whether it's a hotel, a bar, or a venue, and it really needs to make up it's mind, because right now, it's failing as a hotel. My advice? Go to the Drake for a drink or to catch a show in the Underground, and imagine how nice it might've been to stay here, but save your money and have a more comfortable and pleasant stay somewhere else instead.

Reviews.Title: “TIFF at the Drake”
Reviews.Author: outrider
Reviews.Content: I went with my film partner for this years Film Festival and he slected the Drake- I've traveled widely and stayed in many fine hotels but the Drake was a unique and deeply satsidfying experience. While a cab ride away from many of the festival events the distance was well worth it for the combination of laid-back coolness, a great decompression zone with plenty to do on site. The perfect hotel to stay in if you want to get up at noon and end the night at five a.m.- I stayed in 307- a crash pad and was as comfortable or more so than many larger rooms I've been in. Big shout-outs to the whole staff with special mentions going to Jonathan, Jason, Kiki and Jasmine. And also to the relaxed but ever-vigilent security. I've stayed in other fine hotels in Toronto before but now have a new favorite with The Drake.

Reviews.Title: “Coolest Hotel weÂ´ve ever been!!”
Reviews.Author: Trismo
Reviews.Content: We have just come back and we have to recommend everyone this cool/vintage Hotel: great decoration, great feeling, cool staff and a Hotel like no other. Wake up in a kind of small apartment that you wouldnÂ´t mind to live in, take a sexy shower (you will see what I mean when you stay there), have breakfast in their next door cafe, and ready to enjoy an amazing city. And when you come back tired after walk all day, relax and take a cocktail in their amazing patio! And you would also be in a great location to walk Queen St West, the coolest street in Toronto! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED: THE KIND OF PLACE YOU WILL TAKE PICTURES OF AND SHOW TO YOUR FRIENDS!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: alchemistchef
Reviews.Content: What a fun place this was to stay! We were in Room 205 in a Crash Pad and it was truly eclectic. The room was spotlessly clean and well outfitted. Considering the entertainment available at the hotel and the great number of people who avail themselves of it, our room was surprisingly quiet. The location is a little further west than the downtown/harbor area, but the tram stop is directly across the street so getting around was quite easy. Toronto is not a place you'd choose to drive around in if you didn't have to. While the hotel itself does not have parking, the lot across the street is convenient, safe and reasonably priced. The rooms, the drinks and the food are all a little pricey, but all in all we felt it was a good experience and a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Sexy Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: aadams01
Reviews.Content: We live in Toronto, but wanted to have a sexy, city getaway for our 3rd anniversary. I knew that The Drake was a hip, happening place that I had always intended to visit. I researched that the 3rd wedding anniversary is the leather anniversary, so when I saw the leather couch in the XL suite I knew this was the room and hotel for us. I booked directly through The Drake and the people there were fantastic - very helpful, friendly and professional! They arranged for fruits and truffles to be waiting in our room upon arrival, in addition to some items that I pre-ordered from their pleasure menu. They also advised that we could get 10% off on massages at the nearby Hammam spa which was amazing. We had an amazing, memorable night and would definitely recommend. It is not a traditional hotel, but great for modern couples that want a very cool hotel with great people.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a 30's middle class ocean liner stateroom”
Reviews.Author: sastudio
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 days in Toronto at the Drake. I had high expectations of this top design hotel but thundered down when you check in at midnight. The hotel staff is great but services such as room service etc needs some work. When your tired in late from the airport all one wants is food and a drink. There was no food after 11pm. period. A drink yes on a very hip roof top bar. So great if you need a cocktail and a smoke. But the room which was a salon so larger it was a bit of nightmare after travel and cocktails. Trying to find places to unpack, the lighting controls and the best clothes hangin directly next to your bed. It was a 30's middle class ocean liner stateroom with great staff. The morning is was much better, quiet night sleep and great cafe downstairs. In all the place is great for Toronto as there are not a great number of good hotels. I would stay here with a group of friends or groupies that might become friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great style and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Irish_Patrick_London
Reviews.Content: I had a really great time staying at the Drake. it was my first time in Toronto, and I felt the area was much more interesting than staying in the centre as the cafÃ©s and quirky shops on West Queen's Street are cool. The hotel is very stylish, with the roof bar and cafÃ© having a great atmosphere. The room was also very nice and comfortable. the staff took good care of me, especially the manager Jonathan - thanks guys for a great trip. P.S. - the only thing i would recommend changing is the 'apartment sized' ironing boards which are silly - lets have some real ones when I return sometime next year! Patrick

Reviews.Title: “Really cool place!”
Reviews.Author: DMBFan77
Reviews.Content: We decided to book a room at The Drake because of all the feedback we got from the reviews. The reviews are pretty much acurate. Clean and really vintage looking but modern at the same time. It's a weird combo that seems to work. We were very excited about being able to come back from a concert and being able to chill and have a drink at one of the 3 facilities/clubs in the hotel... however, sure enough a week before we arrived we got an e-mail saying that all facilities would not be available due to some stupid "green" event. Disapointed is an understatement. What really irked us was that our room was still super expensive without the added benefit of using bars and dining areas. Although we feel like giving the place a worst rating we still believe that when all the amenities are available this is probably a great place to hang out. We just feel on a personal level that we got the short end of the stick. Great people though at check in! We might give it another chance some day.

Reviews.Title: “Drake - the culteral hub of Toronto where the service is genuine!”
Reviews.Author: MartiniHampshire
Reviews.Content: What a pleasure it was to experience genuine customer service in action -I felt the staff really wanted to help and were genuinely interested in what we were doing in the city, rather than talking from a script. The hotel is a great retreat and a culteral hub, offering good food and drink, with fantastic transport links to the tourist attractions, gallarys, museums etc. Although some distance from the centre of Toronto, it is walkable and enables you to get closer to the real vibe of the city.

Reviews.Title: “A special getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Stanleys2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were just visiting our son in Toronto, and courtesy of him and a friend, we had a night at The Drake. Also included was a wonderful dinner in the restaurant. We absolutely loved the place! The outdoor bar was great, the meal was superb, and the room was something really special. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “the total package - great vibe, great room, great sleep!”
Reviews.Author: metsOttawa
Reviews.Content: I loved my experience at the drake - the restaurant, cafe, and sky yard were all awesome - great vibe, fun menu, and well-planned wine list. my room was small but not at all cramped - just extremely well laid-out, and the super comfortable bed gave me a wonderful night's sleep. Thank you Drake - can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “The Drake was Cake”
Reviews.Author: c1mcgraw
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Drake Hotel while my partner was here on business. The staff here is PHENOMENALLY helpful and friendly (great-looking, too!). I mentioned that I wanted to go sightseeing and snip-snap they printed Google maps of locations I wanted to see and highlighted my route for me. They helped me print & fax anytime needed. I went thrift store shopping, returned to the hotel with my haul and asked for directions to a laundromat -- their manager offered to take my laundry home & do it himself! I asked for recommendations of hair salons; they offered several and then mentioned that their cafe' manager cuts hair as well. The haircut she gave me is adorable (I'm not making this up)! The food is generally moderately priced, and totally delicious. Downstairs outdoor cafe' dining is balanced with a fun, funky lounge, a restaurant area, and an upstairs patio offering outdoor drinks & mingling. The Underground is a great space for music; a gilded proscenium arch framing the stage makes it resemble an old-school theatre. Great design here -- every space is packed with something fun and funky; what might have been a pommel horse in another life greets you when you come in the lobby, and beyond the reception area an antique photo booth anchors a guest seating area. The hotel seems to be a hangout for Toronto folks as well as a draw for travelers. The Drake's renovation was apparently one of the anchors that drove the West Queen West renaissance in recent years. A few notes -- We stayed in one of the crashpad rooms, which were small (though their small space design solutions have a hip, clean minimalist Japanese aesthetic). Wireless in our room at the far end of the third floor crashpads required a lot of network surfing to stay connected, but elsewhere in the hotel fellow conference attendees had blazingly fast and reliable connections in their rooms, so might just need another wireless booster down this end. Finally, there's no lift / elevator, an issue for the differently abled. But for those of us who need a good flight of stairs to tighten our bums anyway, the Drake Hotel is a fantastic value in a unique place with great folks who will make your stay into a fun memory, not just a space to lay your head. An excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “the country wife”
Reviews.Author: yorikiri
Reviews.Content: I think before I mention my stay I should say how I booked my stay..as "other" doesn't really do it!!, my brother lives in the UK .. with the rest of my family and decided to organize some last minute Christmas shopping for my wife and I.. he knew I liked Lulu lemon clothes and so called their branch in Vancouver.. they called him back and chatted for 10 minutes, organized my clothes gift and at the end of the conversation asked the girl he was talking to to recommend a "cool" hotel in downtown Toronto. She said she used to live in Toronto and thought the Drake a great place to stay.. he checked it out online and booked it for me as my Christmas gift.. I then thought that I should use it as my wedding anniversary present and left my son with the inlaws and headed down town with my wife. SO thats how we came to be here.. the stay was excellent.. I was surprised to learn on my arrival that Stephanie knew of my name and knew about one of my ancestors.. after 38 years of travel finally someone knew the name and was so thrilled to realize that I was a direct relation to someone she had studied, and may have even depicted some of his plays on stage.. anyway I was blown away. I think she enjoyed that too!! Stephanie, Jonathan and Jason were extremely helpful and very welcoming.. the rooms were great, service quick, food excellent.. Loved the raw bar, and the sushi was exquisite.. ( lived in Japan for 6 years) .. I recommend it highly, food in the lounge was totally worth every penny and a drink in the roof bar finished things off perfectly. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting something a little more exciting than the usual hotel.. its decor is amazing.. and who could really want for more.. other reviews depict the hotel perfectly. I will be booking my brother a night when he is over on this side of the Atlantic and look forward to revisiting again sometime in the future. Thanks for the help and making our stay so "exciting" cheers Will Guelph Ontario and Shrewsbury England

Reviews.Title: “No mistake to stay at the Drake!”
Reviews.Author: capetrustee
Reviews.Content: With tickets to a Leonard Cohen concert in Hamilton but no desire to stay in Hamilton, the Drake looked good for a quick run to the concert and a couple of days in Toronto. With only 19 rooms of varying size (and cost) the hotel nonetheless provides all anyone could need. Great location on a major streetcar line in a burgeoning art studio section of Toronto, it includes a fine restaurant that serves breakfast till late afternoon as well as lunch and dinner, a lively bar scene that attracts locals as well as guests, and a commitment to fashion, design and art that is apparent throughout the hotel. The young staff who serve as a kind of collective Concierge are knowledgeable, eager to help and made our stay easy and fun. Parking across the street is $10 for a 24-hour period. Will certainly stay at the Drake again.

Reviews.Title: “weekend stay at the Drake”
Reviews.Author: torontoyvette
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time being tourists in our own city- and loved the quirky hotel. The room was very well done, although a bit noisy at night with the bar right underneath us. Good thing we had been warned us about that when we booked.- it was the size of the room that appealed to us. Next time, we'll rest up before we go so we can party with the youngsters..... We really appreciated the little things- the birthday balloons, the pleasure package, the complementary book, the quick room service, the very attentive front-desk staff- making the whole experience alot of fun. We would certainly recommend this west-end stay to any of our visitors looking for a little luxury. Yvette (Toronto)

Reviews.Title: “No reason to stay other than at the Drake”
Reviews.Author: jpatrickyoung
Reviews.Content: I have an affinity for chic boutique hotels and The Drake met and exceeded my expectations. Located in the very trendy Queens West section of Toronto, Drake sets a high standard for the others to follow. The staff is professional, courteous, beautiful, engaging and committed to ensuring a pleasurable stay. The Drake is as advertised, "Hot Bed for Culture". Toronto's bold and beautiful hang out here, be it on the second level Sky Yard, on the Cafe+Boulvard Patio, in the Lounge or The Underground with their live music and luxurious modern trappings. Be assured of a wonderful enlightened experience at The Drake. I've no reason to stay anywhere other than the Drake. Thank you to Anna, Jonathan, Kiki, Angie, Stew and all the other staff members who assured my return the nex time I am in town.

Reviews.Title: “Always love the Drake - fun, funky, friendly”
Reviews.Author: BizLuxTrvlr
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Drake for three years every time I go to Toronto for business. The rooms are very well designed, the vibe is fun, the restaurants are great and the staff is friendly. It's the best value in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Canadian Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Inhabit
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough great things about the Drake. Brilliant use of space, the room is tiny but you almost don't notice because the execution is so perfect. The common spaces are hip, inviting and the staff is helpful and friendly. We were snowed in all day and didn't mind one bit. We spent the day entertained by great staff, food, drinks, movies and stayed warm by the fire in the lounge. There are boutique hotels that are 'cool'. This hotel is far more. It is inspired by the creative art community it is in and is a treat from check in to check out. It is not a business hotel; the stairs are a bit treacherous and the place is hopping til 2am, so if you want quite, easy and spacious, go somewhere else. This place is for those that appreciate the art of living.

Reviews.Title: “Irishcurse”
Reviews.Author: irishcurse
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute stay, only one night on Carrabana weekend. We heard about this hotel from friends of a friend while sitting over cocktails at Mother's in Buffalo, NY. These folks were so excited about this hotel that they actually had it on "speed dial". After twenty minutes they had my girlfriend and I so excited that I called on the spot and made a reservation. The Hotel is in an artsy neighborhood, well west of downtown TO. We had drinks in the outdoor cafe while waiting for our room to be readied. To say the neighborhood is "eclectic" is an understatement, but it is fun. Our room (301) was a "Den" about 185 sq. ft. and it was incredible, what a great use of space! Hard to believe that there is so much in such a small place, the room itself is FUN. The public spaces were great. We had a great dinner in the Dining Room with a wonderful server named Allen (Al) quite a character. While dining they had a Jazz group playing in the lounge which is on the other side of a staircase that goes to the SkyBar. The SkyBar is the happening place in the area, again all kinds of people, all ages. The employees at this property are outstanding and always willing to help with all your needs. A special thank you to Stephanie the front desk clerk who checked us in and explained everything about the hotel. While this hotel may not be for everyone, be adventurous, go for it, you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: gunnarh
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious and clean with a very funky decor. Loved the shower. The people working there were incredibly friendly and helpful. I was worried that the evening entertainment would interrupt our sleep, but you couldn't hear anything once you were in the room. Loved having drinks and sushi upstairs on the deck. The neighborhood is great for window shopping, too! We highly recommend the Drake.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Have A Wedding”
Reviews.Author: Jenpolysci
Reviews.Content: I was married on the roof of the Drake with the reception in the Underground and it was amazing. The staff is incredible. The artwork and vibe of the place makes the whole experience interesting. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Had dinner and stayed, Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: kimmycat_meow
Reviews.Content: Wow! It was an amazing experience. I stayed for the weekend and the hotel is so retro fun! I loooved it! I had dinner in the dining room and the service was amazing, and the food was incredible. Chef Anthony Rose really had a flare for his cuisine. I ended up staying after dinner and having a few cocktails on the Sky Yard then heading back to my room. The entire staff was so helpful and the building was immaculate. I would recommend this venue as a great place to stay while visiting Toronto. The whole Queen West area is so safe and there is so many interesting shops and cute bars. I canâ€™t wait to visit again!!

Reviews.Title: “For the hip and not the hip replacements”
Reviews.Author: ShootExperience
Reviews.Content: We recently flew to Canada from London, UK to produce an event at the Drake Hotel. As a first "snap shot" of Toronto is was a great starting point. The area is superb, probably the coolest part of Toronto - though i suppose we all have different cool-ometers! bars, restaurants, Trinity Bellwoods park, lots of shopping - it's all there. China town is a 20 minute walk as is Kensington if you are into a taste of Mexico and loads of second hand clothing stores. The experience at the drake could not have been topped. We stayed five nights and were gutted to leave. I think the hotel concept rocks - GREAT decor, amazing staff, cafe, roof top bar, lounge, bar, restaurant, club - all under one roof - all very arty and cultured in my opinion, complete with an artist in residence. Their finger is on the pulse and lots are seeming to follow. We were there on business producing an event called Shoot Toronto.. We ate breakfast at the hotel cafe every morning, used the free WIFI access to death - generally spent a lot of time in the cafe outside on the veranda - there was a heat wave that weekend... This hotel is for the hip and not the hip replacements. I can't wait to go back. See my blog for more - htttp://www.shootexperience.com/blog

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service!”
Reviews.Author: DesignDiva24
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Drake hotel on March 1st, 2007. I just wanted to say that your hotel was fabulous. I will always remeber how wonderful it was because my now fiance asked me to Marry him there! I found the service just amazing. I used to work in the hospitality industry and I really value good service. All of your staff was super friendly and definetly exceeded our expectations. Thank you so much for making one of the most important days in my life even more wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Once is enough”
Reviews.Author: Chiorazzi
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I did not take the advise of a previous reviewer and I ended up in Room 203. What he didn't mention is the beer deliveries that commence each morning. Each keg as it is delivered at about 8 am is slammed onto the sideway. The finale is the noise as the empty beer bottles are sent dwon a conveyer to be loaded onto the truck. All this at about 8am. The design of the room was brilliant and unique. The sheets nice, mattress could have been better. The service was spotty. Some were pleasant and helpful at the front desk, some had an attitude - I think it is a age issue - all of them pretty young. There is no help in to the front door even if you are struggling with two back and opening the door. I think they must be amused to watch. No bell man. Though they did find me help to get my bags up the stairs. Though I was on my own on the way out. No elevator. I thought the location to be a bit out of the way in terms of downtown. There is a street car stop that makes it easier but if you just like to walk like I do - it is a hike. The cafe was great - I enjoyed the yougart, fruit and granola dish. Lots of locals like it as there hangout. I wasn't too disturb by the evening activities but i see how some unexpecting guests would be. There are three bars and they are very well known. Noise wasn't too bad the days I was there. Definite a place to stay at least once but for the price they charge I expect better service and attention and afternoon beer deliveries.
